verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses in the desert of Sinai, in the tabernacle of the covenant, on the first day of the second month, in the year after their departure from Egypt, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen in deserto Sinai in tabernaculo fœderis, prima die mensis secundi, anno altero egressionis eorum ex Ægypto, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Take a total of the entire assembly of the sons of Israel, by their families and houses, and the names of each one, of whomever is of the male sex,
verses.textLa: Tollite summam universæ congregationis filiorum Israel per cognationes et domos suas, et nomina singulorum, quidquid sexus est masculini

verses.textEn: from twenty years and above, of all the able-bodied men out of Israel, and you shall number them by their companies, you and Aaron.
verses.textLa: a vigesimo anno et supra, omnium virorum fortium ex Israel, et numerabitis eos per turmas suas, tu et Aaron.

verses.textEn: And there shall be with you the leaders of the tribes, as well as of the houses, in their kinships,
verses.textLa: Eruntque vobiscum principes tribuum ac domorum in cognationibus suis,

verses.textEn: the names of whom are these: of Ruben, Elizur the son of Shedeur;
verses.textLa: quorum ista sunt nomina: De Ruben, Elisur filius Sedeur,

verses.textEn: of Simeon, Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai;
verses.textLa: de Simeon, Salamiel filius Surisaddai,

verses.textEn: of Judah, Nahshon the son of Amminadab;
verses.textLa: de Iuda, Nahasson filius Aminadab,

verses.textEn: of Issachar, Nathanael the son of Zuar;
verses.textLa: de Issachar, Nathanael filius Suar,

verses.textEn: of Zebulon, Eliab the son of Helon.
verses.textLa: de Zabulon, Eliab filius Helon.

verses.textEn: And from the sons of Joseph: of Ephraim, Elishama the son of Ammihud; of Manasseh, Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur;
verses.textLa: Filiorum autem Ioseph: de Ephraim, Elisama filius Ammiud, de Manasse, Gamaliel filius Phadassur,

verses.textEn: of Benjamin, Abidan the son of Gideoni;
verses.textLa: de Beniamin, Abidan filius Gedeonis,

verses.textEn: of Dan, Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai;
verses.textLa: de Dan, Ahiezer filius Ammisaddai,

verses.textEn: of Asher, Pagiel the son of Ochran;
verses.textLa: de Aser, Phegiel filius Ochran,

verses.textEn: of Gad, Eliasaph the son of Reuel;
verses.textLa: de Gad, Eliasaph filius Duel,

verses.textEn: of Naphtali, Ahira the son of Enan.”
verses.textLa: de Nephthali, Ahira filius Enan.

verses.textEn: These are the very noble leaders of the multitude, by their tribes and kinships, and the heads of the army of Israel.
verses.textLa: Hi nobilissimi principes multitudinis per tribus et cognationes suas, et capita exercitus Israel:

verses.textEn: Moses and Aaron took these, with all the multitude of the common people,
verses.textLa: quos tulerunt Moyses et Aaron cum omni vulgi multitudine:

verses.textEn: and they gathered them together on the first day of the second month, taking a census of them by kinships, and houses, and families, and heads, and the names of each one from twenty years and above,
verses.textLa: et congregaverunt primo die mensis secundi, recensentes eos per cognationes, et domos, ac familias, et capita, et nomina singulorum a vigesimo anno et supra,

verses.textEn: just as the Lord had instructed Moses. And they were numbered in the desert of Sinai.
verses.textLa: sicut præceperat Dominus Moysi. Numeratique sunt in deserto Sinai.

verses.textEn: Of Ruben, the firstborn of Israel, by their generations and families and houses, and the names of each head, of all who were of the male sex, from twenty years and above, capable of going to war,
verses.textLa: De Ruben primogenito Israelis per generationes et familias ac domos suas, et nomina capitum singulorum, omne quod sexus est masculini a vigesimo anno et supra, procedentium ad bellum,

verses.textEn: there were forty-six thousand five hundred.
verses.textLa: quadraginta sex millia quingenti.

verses.textEn: Of the sons of Simeon, by their generations and families, and the houses of their kinships, having been counted by the names and heads of each one, of all who were of the male sex, from twenty years and above, capable of going to war,
verses.textLa: De filiis Simeon per generationes et familias ac domos cognationum suarum recensiti sunt per nomina et capita singulorum, omne quod sexus est masculini a vigesimo anno et supra, procedentium ad bellum,

verses.textEn: there were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
verses.textLa: quinquaginta novem millia trecenti.

verses.textEn: Of the sons of Gad, by their generations and families, and the houses of their kinships, having been counted by the names of each one, from twenty years and above, of all who could go forth to war,
verses.textLa: De filiis Gad per generationes et familias ac domos cognationum suarum recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum a viginti annis et supra, omnes qui ad bella procederent,

verses.textEn: there were forty-five thousand six hundred fifty.
verses.textLa: quadraginta quinque millia sexcenti quinquaginta.

verses.textEn: Of the sons of Judah, by their generations and families, and the houses of their kinships, by the names of each one, from twenty years and above, of all who were able to go forth to war,
verses.textLa: De filiis Iuda per generationes et familias ac domos cognationum suarum, per nomina singulorum a vigesimo anno et supra, omnes qui poterant ad bella procedere,

verses.textEn: there were counted seventy-four thousand six hundred.
verses.textLa: recensiti sunt septuaginta quattuor millia sexcenti.

verses.textEn: Of the sons of Issachar, by their generations and families, and the houses of their kinships, by the names of each one, from twenty years and above, of all who could go forth to war,
verses.textLa: De filiis Issachar, per generationes et familias ac domos cognationum suarum, per nomina singulorum a vigesimo anno et supra, omnes qui ad bella procederent,

verses.textEn: there were counted fifty-four thousand four hundred.
verses.textLa: recensiti sunt quinquaginta quattuor millia quadringenti.

verses.textEn: Of the sons of Zebulon, by their generations and families, and the houses of their kinships, having been counted by the names of each one, from twenty years and above, of all who were able to go forth to war,
verses.textLa: De filiis Zabulon per generationes et familias, ac domos cognationum suarum recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum a vigesimo anno et supra, omnes qui poterant ad bella procedere,

verses.textEn: there were fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
verses.textLa: quinquaginta septem millia quadringenti.

verses.textEn: From the sons of Joseph, of the sons of Ephraim, by their generations and families, and the houses of their kinships, having been counted by the names of each one, from twenty years and above, of all who were able to go forth to war,
verses.textLa: De filiis Ioseph, filiorum Ephraim per generationes, et familias, ac domos cognationum suarum recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum a vigesimo anno et supra, omnes qui poterant ad bella procedere,

verses.textEn: there were forty thousand five hundred.
verses.textLa: quadraginta millia quingenti.

verses.textEn: Furthermore, of the sons of Manasseh, by their generations and families, and the houses of their kinships, having been counted by the names of each one, from twenty years and above, of all who were able to go forth to war,
verses.textLa: Porro filiorum Manasse per generationes et familias ac domos cognationum suarum recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum a viginti annis et supra, omnes qui poterant ad bella procedere,

verses.textEn: there were thirty-two thousand two hundred.
verses.textLa: triginta duo millia ducenti.

verses.textEn: Of the sons of Benjamin, by their generations and families, and the houses of their kinships, having been counted by the names of each one, from twenty years and above, of all who were able to go forth to war,
verses.textLa: De filiis Beniamin per generationes et familias ac domos cognationum suarum recensiti sunt nominibus singulorum a vigesimo anno et supra, omnes qui poterant ad bella procedere,

verses.textEn: there were thirty-five thousand four hundred.
verses.textLa: triginta quinque millia quadringenti.

verses.textEn: Of the sons of Dan, by their generations and families, and the houses of their kinships, having been counted by the names of each one, from twenty years and above, of all who were able to go forth to war,
verses.textLa: De filiis Dan per generationes, et familias ac domos cognationum suarum recensiti sunt nominibus singulorum a vigesimo anno et supra, omnes qui poterant ad bella procedere,

verses.textEn: there were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
verses.textLa: sexaginta duo millia septingenti.

verses.textEn: Of the sons of Asher, by their generations and families, and the houses of their kinships, having been counted by the names of each one, from twenty years and above, of all who were able to go forth to war,
verses.textLa: De filiis Aser per generationes et familias ac domos cognationum suarum recensiti sunt per nomina singulorum a vigesimo anno et supra, omnes qui poterant ad bella procedere,

verses.textEn: there were forty thousand and one thousand five hundred.
verses.textLa: quadraginta millia et mille quingenti.
verses.notes: The phrasing in the Latin separating the forty thousand from the one thousand five hundred may have some spiritual level of meaning, so the translation leaves these numbers separated, rather than adding them together.

verses.textEn: Of the sons of Naphtali, by their generations and families, and the houses of their kinships, having been counted by the names of each one, from twenty years and above, of all who were able to go forth to war,
verses.textLa: De filiis Nephthali per generationes et familias ac domos cognationum suarum recensiti sunt nominibus singulorum a vigesimo anno et supra, omnes qui poterant ad bella procedere,

verses.textEn: there were fifty-three thousand four hundred.
verses.textLa: quinquaginta tria millia quadringenti.

verses.textEn: These are the ones who were numbered by Moses and Aaron and the twelve leaders of Israel, each one by the houses of their kinships.
verses.textLa: Hi sunt, quos numeraverunt Moyses et Aaron, et duodecim principes Israel, singulos per domos cognationum suarum.

verses.textEn: And the entire number of the sons of Israel by their houses and families, from twenty years and above, who were able to go forth to war, were
verses.textLa: Fueruntque omnis numerus filiorum Israel per domos et familias suas a vigesimo anno et supra, qui poterant ad bella procedere,

verses.textEn: six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty men.
verses.textLa: sexcenta tria millia virorum quingenti quinquaginta.

verses.textEn: But the Levites in the tribes of their families were not numbered with them.
verses.textLa: Levitæ autem in tribu familiarum suarum non sunt numerati cum eis.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Do not number the tribe of Levi, neither shall you take a total of them with the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Tribum Levi noli numerare, neque pones summam eorum cum filiis Israel:

verses.textEn: But appoint them over the tabernacle of the testimony, and all its vessels, and whatever pertains to the ceremonies. They shall carry the tabernacle and all its articles. And they shall be for the ministry, and they shall encamp all around the tabernacle.
verses.textLa: sed constitue eos super tabernaculum testimonii et cuncta vasa eius, et quidquid ad ceremonias pertinet. Ipsi portabunt tabernaculum et omnia utensilia eius: et erunt in ministerio, ac per gyrum tabernaculi metabuntur.

verses.textEn: When you would depart, the Levites shall take down the tabernacle. When you are to make camp, they shall set it up. Any outsider who will approach it shall be killed.
verses.textLa: Cum proficiscendum fuerit, deponent Levitæ tabernaculum: cum castrametandum, erigent. Quisquis externorum accesserit, occidetur.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Israel shall make camp, each one by his companies and bands, as well as his army.
verses.textLa: Metabuntur autem castra filii Israel unusquisque per turmas et cuneos atque exercitum suum.
verses.notes: These three terms (turmas, cuneos, exercitum) appear to be based on ancient military distinctions. The term ‘cuneos,’ literally means ‘wedge,’ probably referring to a wedge-like formation of troops.

verses.textEn: Moreover, the Levites shall fix their tents all around the tabernacle, lest there be an indignation over the multitude of the sons of Israel. And they shall stand watch as guardians over the tabernacle of the testimony.”
verses.textLa: Porro Levitæ per gyrum tabernaculi figent tentoria, ne fiat indignatio super multitudinem filiorum Israel, et excubabunt in custodiis tabernaculi testimonii.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the sons of Israel acted according to everything that the Lord had instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: Fecerunt ergo filii Israel iuxta omnia quæ præceperat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Each one shall make camp, by their troops, as well as by their insignia and standards, and by the houses of their kinships, all around the tabernacle of the covenant.”
verses.textLa: Singuli per turmas, signa, atque vexilla, et domos cognationum suarum castrametabuntur filii Israel, per gyrum tabernaculi fœderis.

verses.textEn: To the east, Judah shall fix his tents, by the companies of his army. And the leader of his sons shall be Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
verses.textLa: Ad Orientem Iudas figet tentoria per turmas exercitus sui: eritque princeps filiorum eius Nahasson filius Aminadab.

verses.textEn: And the entire total of the fighting men from his stock was seventy-four thousand six hundred.
verses.textLa: Et omnis de stirpe eius summa pugnantium, septuaginta quattuor millia sexcenti.

verses.textEn: Beside him, those of the tribe of Issachar were encamped, whose leader was Nathanael the son of Zuar.
verses.textLa: Iuxta eum castrametati sunt de tribu Issachar, quorum princeps fuit Nathanael filius Suar.

verses.textEn: And the entire number of his fighting men was fifty-four thousand four hundred.
verses.textLa: Et omnis numerus pugnatorum eius quinquaginta quattuor millia quadringenti.

verses.textEn: In the tribe of Zebulon, the leader was Eliab the son of Helon.
verses.textLa: In tribu Zabulon princeps fuit Eliab filius Helon.

verses.textEn: All the army of fighting men from his stock were fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
verses.textLa: Omnis de stirpe eius exercitus pugnatorum, quinquaginta septem millia quadringenti.

verses.textEn: All who were numbered in the camp of Judah were one hundred eighty-six thousand four hundred. And these, by their companies, shall go forth first.
verses.textLa: Universi qui in castris Iudæ annumerati sunt, fuerunt centum octoginta sex millia quadringenti: et per turmas suas primi egredientur.

verses.textEn: In the camp of the sons of Ruben, toward the south side, the leader shall be Elizur the son of Shedeur.
verses.textLa: In castris filiorum Ruben ad meridianam plagam erit princeps Elisur filius Sedeur:

verses.textEn: And the entire army of his fighting men, who were numbered, were forty-six thousand five hundred.
verses.textLa: et cunctus exercitus pugnatorum eius qui numerati sunt, quadraginta sex millia quingenti.

verses.textEn: Beside him, those of the tribe of Simeon were encamped, whose leader was Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
verses.textLa: Iuxta eum castrametati sunt de tribu Simeon: quorum princeps fuit Salamiel filius Surisaddai.

verses.textEn: And the entire army of his fighting men, who were numbered, were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
verses.textLa: Et cunctus exercitus pugnatorum eius, qui numerati sunt, quinquaginta novem millia trecenti.

verses.textEn: In the tribe of Gad, the leader was Eliasaph the son of Reuel.
verses.textLa: In tribu Gad princeps fuit Eliasaph filius Duel.

verses.textEn: And the entire army of his fighting men, who were numbered, were forty-five thousand six hundred fifty.
verses.textLa: Et cunctus exercitus pugnatorum eius, qui numerati sunt, quadraginta quinque millia sexcenti quinquaginta.

verses.textEn: All who were counted in the camp of Ruben were one hundred fifty thousand and one thousand four hundred fifty, by their companies. These shall advance in the second place.
verses.textLa: Omnes qui recensiti sunt in castris Ruben, centum quinquaginta millia et mille quadringenti quinquaginta per turmas suas: in secundo loco proficiscentur.
verses.notes: The phrasing in the Latin separating the two numbers may have some spiritual level of meaning, so the translation leaves these numbers separated, rather than adding them together.

verses.textEn: But the tabernacle of the testimony shall be lifted up by the officers of the Levites and their companies. In the manner in which it is set up, so also shall it be taken down. Each one shall advance according to their places and ranks.
verses.textLa: Levabitur autem tabernaculum testimonii per officia Levitarum et turmas eorum. Quomodo erigetur, ita et deponetur. Singuli per loca et ordines suos proficiscentur.

verses.textEn: On the west side, there shall be the camp of the sons of Ephraim, whose leader was Elishama the son of Ammihud.
verses.textLa: Ad occidentalem plagam erunt castra filiorum Ephraim, quorum princeps fuit Elisama filius Ammiud.

verses.textEn: The entire army of his fighting men, who were numbered, were forty thousand five hundred.
verses.textLa: Cunctus exercitus pugnatorum eius, qui numerati sunt, quadraginta millia quingenti.

verses.textEn: And with them was the tribe of the sons of Manasseh, whose leader was Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
verses.textLa: Et cum eis tribus filiorum Manasse, quorum princeps fuit Gamaliel filius Phadassur.

verses.textEn: And the entire army of his fighting men, who were numbered, were thirty-two thousand two hundred.
verses.textLa: Cunctusque exercitus pugnatorum eius, qui numerati sunt, triginta duo millia ducenti.

verses.textEn: In the tribe of the sons of Benjamin, the leader was Abidan the son of Gideoni.
verses.textLa: In tribu filiorum Beniamin princeps fuit Abidan filius Gedeonis.

verses.textEn: And the entire army of his fighting men, who were counted, were thirty-five thousand four hundred.
verses.textLa: Et cunctus exercitus pugnatorum eius, qui recensiti sunt, triginta quinque millia quadringenti.

verses.textEn: All who were numbered in the camp of Ephraim were one hundred eight thousand one hundred, by their companies. These shall advance third.
verses.textLa: Omnes qui numerati sunt in castris Ephraim, centum octo millia centum per turmas suas: tertii proficiscentur.

verses.textEn: Toward the north side, the sons of Dan were encamped, whose leader was Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
verses.textLa: Ad Aquilonis partem castrametati sunt filii Dan: quorum princeps fuit Ahiezer filius Ammisaddai.
verses.notes: The Antichrist is said to be a descendent of the tribe of Dan; he will first take power in the North, and he will advance from the North as he begins his reign.

verses.textEn: The entire army of his fighting men, who were numbered, were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
verses.textLa: Cunctus exercitus pugnatorum eius, qui numerati sunt, sexaginta duo millia septingenti.

verses.textEn: Beside him, those of the tribe of Asher fixed their tents, whose leader was Pagiel the son of Ochran.
verses.textLa: Iuxta eum fixere tentoria de tribu Aser: quorum princeps fuit Phegiel filius Ochran.

verses.textEn: The entire army of his fighting men, who were numbered, were forty thousand and one thousand five hundred.
verses.textLa: Cunctus exercitus pugnatorum eius, qui numerati sunt, quadraginta millia et mille quingenti.

verses.textEn: From the tribe of the sons of Naphtali, the leader was Ahira the son of Enan.
verses.textLa: De tribu filiorum Nephthali princeps fuit Ahira filius Enan.

verses.textEn: The entire army of his fighting men were fifty-three thousand four hundred.
verses.textLa: Cunctus exercitus pugnatorum eius, quinquaginta tria millia quadringenti.

verses.textEn: All who were numbered in the camp of Dan were one hundred fifty-seven thousand six hundred; and these shall advance at the very end.
verses.textLa: Omnes, qui numerati sunt in castris Dan, fuerunt centum quinquaginta septem millia sexcenti: et novissimi proficiscentur.

verses.textEn: This is the number of the sons of Israel, of their army divided by the houses of their kinships and their companies: six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty.
verses.textLa: Hic numerus filiorum Israel, per domos cognationum suarum et turmas divisi exercitus, sexcenta tria millia quingenti quinquaginta.

verses.textEn: But the Levites were not numbered among the sons of Israel. For so the Lord had instructed Moses.
verses.textLa: Levitæ autem non sunt numerati inter filios Israel: sic enim præceperat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Israel acted according to all the things that the Lord had commanded. They were encamped by their companies, and they advanced by the families and houses of their fathers.
verses.textLa: Feceruntque filii Israel iuxta omnia quæ mandaverat Dominus. Castrametati sunt per turmas suas, et profecti per familias ac domos patrum suorum.

verses.textEn: These are the generations of Aaron and Moses, in the day when the Lord spoke to Moses on mount Sinai.
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt generationes Aaron et Moysi in die qua locutus est Dominus ad Moysen in monte Sinai.

verses.textEn: And these are the names of the sons of Aaron: his firstborn Nadab, then Abihu, and Eleazar, and Ithamar.
verses.textLa: Et hæc nomina filiorum Aaron: primogenitus eius Nadab, deinde Abiu, et Eleazar, et Ithamar.

verses.textEn: These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the priests who were anointed and whose hands were filled and consecrated in order to exercise the priesthood.
verses.textLa: Hæc nomina filiorum Aaron sacerdotum qui uncti sunt, et quorum repletæ et consecratæ manus ut sacerdotio fungerentur.

verses.textEn: For Nadab and Abihu died without children, when they offered, in the sight of the Lord, a strange fire, in the desert of Sinai. And so, Eleazar and Ithamar exercised the priesthood in the sight of Aaron, their father.
verses.textLa: Mortui sunt enim Nadab et Abiu cum offerrent ignem alienum in conspectu Domini in deserto Sinai, absque liberis: functique sunt sacerdotio Eleazar et Ithamar coram Aaron patre suo.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Bring forward the tribe of Levi, and cause them to stand in the sight of Aaron the priest, in order to minister to him. And let them keep watch outside,
verses.textLa: Applica tribum Levi, et fac stare in conspectu Aaron sacerdotis ut ministrent ei, et excubent,

verses.textEn: and let them observe whatever pertains to the ritual for the multitude, in front of the tabernacle of the testimony,
verses.textLa: et observent quidquid ad cultum pertinet multitudinis coram tabernaculo testimonii,

verses.textEn: and let them take care of the vessels of the tabernacle, serving in its ministry.
verses.textLa: et custodiant vasa tabernaculi, servientes in ministerio eius.

verses.textEn: And you shall give the Levites as a gift to Aaron and his sons; for they have been delivered to them by the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Dabisque dono Levitas Aaron et filiis eius, quibus traditi sunt a filiis Israel.

verses.textEn: But you shall appoint Aaron and his sons over the service of the priesthood. The outsider who approaches to minister shall be put to death.”
verses.textLa: Aaron autem et filios eius constitues super cultum sacerdotii. Externus, qui ad ministrandum accesserit, morietur.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “I have taken the Levites from the sons of Israel. For the Levites, and all the firstborn who open the womb among the sons of Israel, shall be mine.
verses.textLa: Ego tuli Levitas a filiis Israel pro omni primogenito, qui aperit vulvam in filiis Israel, eruntque Levitæ mei.

verses.textEn: For every firstborn is mine. From the time that I struck the firstborn in the land of Egypt, I have sanctified for myself whatever is born first in Israel. From man, even to beast, they are mine. I am the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Meum est enim omne primogenitum: ex quo percussi primogenitos in Terra Ægypti: sanctificavi mihi quidquid primum nascitur in Israel ab homine usque ad pecus, mei sunt: ego Dominus.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses in the desert of Sinai, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen in deserto Sinai, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Number the sons of Levi by the houses of their fathers and their families, every male from one month and above.”
verses.textLa: Numera filios Levi per domos patrum suorum et familias, omnem masculum ab uno mense, et supra.

verses.textEn: Moses numbered them, just as the Lord had instructed,
verses.textLa: Numeravit Moyses, ut præceperat Dominus,

verses.textEn: and there were found the sons of Levi by their names: Gershon and Kohath and Merari.
verses.textLa: et inventi sunt filii Levi per nomina sua, Gerson et Caath et Merari.

verses.textEn: The sons of Gershon: Libni and Shimei.
verses.textLa: Filii Gerson: Lebni et Semei.

verses.textEn: The sons of Kohath: Amram, and Izhar, Hebron and Uzziel.
verses.textLa: Filii Caath: Amram et Iesaar, Hebron et Oziel.

verses.textEn: The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi.
verses.textLa: Filii Merari: Moholi et Musi.

verses.textEn: From Gershon were two families: the Libnites, and the Shimeites.
verses.textLa: De Gerson fuere familiæ duæ, Lebnitica, et Semeitica:

verses.textEn: The people of these were numbered, of the male sex, from one month and above: seven thousand five hundred.
verses.textLa: quarum numeratus est populus sexus masculini ab uno mense et supra, septem millia quingenti.

verses.textEn: These shall encamp behind the tabernacle, toward the west,
verses.textLa: Hi post tabernaculum metabuntur ad Occidentem

verses.textEn: under the leader Eliasaph the son of Lael.
verses.textLa: sub principe Eliasaph filio Lael.

verses.textEn: And they shall keep watch over the tabernacle of the covenant:
verses.textLa: Et habebunt excubias in tabernaculo fœderis,

verses.textEn: the tabernacle itself, and its covering; the tent that is drawn before the doors of the covering of the covenant; and the curtains of the atrium; likewise, the tent that is suspended at the entrance of the atrium of the tabernacle; and whatever pertains to the ritual of the altar; the cords of the tabernacle and all its implements.
verses.textLa: ipsum tabernaculum et operimentum eius, tentorium quod trahitur ante fores tecti fœderis, et cortinas atrii: tentorium quoque quod appenditur in introitu atrii tabernaculi, et quidquid ad ritum altaris pertinet, funes tabernaculi et omnia utensilia eius.

verses.textEn: The kinship of Kohath includes the peoples of the Amramites and Izharites and Hebronites and Uzzielites. These are the families of the Kohathites, having been counted by their names,
verses.textLa: Cognatio Caath habebit populos Amramitas et Iesaaritas et Hebronitas et Ozielitas. Hæ sunt familiæ Caathitarum recensitæ per nomina sua:

verses.textEn: all those of the male gender, from one month and above: eight thousand six hundred. They shall keep watch over the Sanctuary,
verses.textLa: omnes generis masculini ab uno mense et supra, octo millia sexcenti habebunt excubias Sanctuarii,
verses.notes: More than one tribe is given the duty of keeping watch over the Sanctuary, perhaps because a watch was needed on all four sides.

verses.textEn: and they shall encamp toward the south side.
verses.textLa: et castrametabuntur ad meridianam plagam.

verses.textEn: And their leader shall be Elisaphan the son of Uzziel.
verses.textLa: Princepsque eorum erit Elisaphan filius Oziel:

verses.textEn: And they shall take care of the ark, and the table and the lampstand, the altars and the vessels of the Sanctuary, by which they minister, and the veil, and all the articles of this kind.
verses.textLa: et custodient arcam, mensamque et candelabrum, altaria et vasa Sanctuarii, in quibus ministratur, et velum, cunctamque huiuscemodi supellectilem.

verses.textEn: But the leader of the leaders of the Levites, Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, shall be over those who watch over the care of the Sanctuary.
verses.textLa: Princeps autem principum Levitarum Eleazar filius Aaron sacerdotis, erit super excubitores custodiæ Sanctuarii.

verses.textEn: And truly, from Merari are the peoples of the Mahlites and Mushites, having been counted by their names,
verses.textLa: At vero de Merari erunt populi Moholitæ et Musitæ recensiti per nomina sua:

verses.textEn: all those of the male gender, from one month and above: six thousand two hundred.
verses.textLa: omnes generis masculini ab uno mense et supra, sex millia ducenti.

verses.textEn: Their leader is Suriel the son of Abihaiel. They shall make camp on the north side.
verses.textLa: Princeps eorum Suriel filius Abihaiel: in plaga septentrionali castrametabuntur.

verses.textEn: Under their care shall be the panels of the tabernacle, and the bars, and the columns with their bases, and all the things which pertain to service of this kind,
verses.textLa: Erunt sub custodia eorum tabulæ tabernaculi et vectes, et columnæ ac bases earum, et omnia quæ ad cultum huiuscemodi pertinent:

verses.textEn: and the columns of the surrounding atrium with their bases, and the tent pegs with their cords.
verses.textLa: columnæque atrii per circuitum cum basibus suis, et paxilli cum funibus.

verses.textEn: Moses and Aaron, with their sons, shall make camp before the tabernacle of the covenant, that is, on the east side, holding the custody of the Sanctuary in the midst of the sons of Israel. Whatever foreigner approaches it shall die.
verses.textLa: Castrametabuntur ante tabernaculum fœderis, id est, ad orientalem plagam, Moyses et Aaron cum filiis suis, habentes custodiam Sanctuarii in medio filiorum Israel. Quisquis alienus accesserit, morietur.

verses.textEn: All the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron numbered by their families according to the precept of the Lord, of the male gender, from one month and above, were twenty-two thousand.
verses.textLa: Omnes Levitæ, quos numeraverunt Moyses et Aaron iuxta præceptum Domini per familias suas in genere masculino a mense uno et supra, fuerunt viginti duo millia.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to Moses: “Number the firstborn of the male sex from the sons of Israel, from one month and above, and you shall take their total.
verses.textLa: Et ait Dominus ad Moysen: Numera primogenitos sexus masculini de filiis Israel ab uno mense et supra, et habebis summam eorum.

verses.textEn: And you shall bring the Levites to me, in place of all the firstborn of the sons of Israel, and you shall bring their cattle to me, in place of all the firstborn of the cattle of the sons of Israel. I am the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Tollesque Levitas mihi pro omni primogenito filiorum Israel, ego sum Dominus: et pecora eorum pro universis primogenitis pecorum filiorum Israel.

verses.textEn: Moses took a census, just as the Lord had instructed, of the firstborn of the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Recensuit Moyses, sicut præceperat Dominus, primogenitos filiorum Israel.

verses.textEn: And the males by their names, from one month and above, were twenty-two thousand two hundred seventy-three.
verses.textLa: Et fuerunt masculi per nomina sua, a mense uno et supra, viginti duo millia ducenti septuaginta tres.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Take the Levites, in place of the firstborn of the sons of Israel, and the cattle of the Levites, in place of their cattle, and so the Levites shall be mine. I am the Lord.
verses.textLa: Tolle Levitas pro primogenitis filiorum Israel, et pecora Levitarum pro pecoribus eorum, eruntque Levitæ mei. Ego sum Dominus.

verses.textEn: But for the price of the two hundred and seventy-three, which exceed the number of the Levites compared to the number of firstborn of the sons of Israel,
verses.textLa: In pretio autem ducentorum septuaginta trium, qui excedunt numerum Levitarum de primogenitis filiorum Israel,
verses.notes:
The total number of Levites was actually 22,300; but the number reported as the total was 22,000. This may be due to rounding: the numbers 7,500 and 8,600 and 6200 are probably rounded to the nearest hundred; then, the 22,300 is rounded down to the nearest thousand. Getting an exact number in a census of a very large group is very difficult. Some children are passing their first month, so they enter into the count of the census; some persons die as the census is taking place. It might take weeks or months to take a census, especially since their main occupation in the desert of Sinai was tasks needed to survive. It may also be that these numbers are symbolic; 100 is subtracted from each of the three tribes (300) to make 22,000.
 Notice that the number of the sons of Israel, 20 years and older, excluding the Levites, is 603,550 men; but the number of the first born males one month and older is only 22,273. This is one first born for every 27 or so males of 20 years and up, so that would be an even greater proportion if we knew how many males were between one month and 20 years. In ancient times, and up until the early 20th century, the mortality rate for infants and children was high. In human history, most persons died in childhood, until the 20th century. So the number of surviving first born sons is low.

verses.textEn: you shall take five shekels for each head, by the measure of the Sanctuary. A shekel has twenty obols.
verses.textLa: accipies quinque siclos per singula capita ad mensuram Sanctuarii. Siclus habet viginti obolos.

verses.textEn: And you shall give the money to Aaron and his sons as the price of those that are in excess.”
verses.textLa: Dabisque pecuniam Aaron et filiis eius pretium eorum qui supra sunt.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Moses took the money for those that were in excess, and whom they had redeemed from the Levites
verses.textLa: Tulit igitur Moyses pecuniam eorum, qui fuerant amplius, et quos redemerant a Levitis

verses.textEn: in place of the firstborn of the sons of Israel: one thousand three hundred sixty-five shekels, according to the weight of the Sanctuary.
verses.textLa: pro primogenitis filiorum Israel, mille trecentorum sexaginta quinque siclorum iuxta pondus Sanctuarii,

verses.textEn: And he gave it to Aaron and his sons, according to the word by which the Lord had instructed him.
verses.textLa: et dedit eam Aaron et filiis eius iuxta verbum quod præceperat sibi Dominus.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Take a total of the sons of Kohath from the midst of the Levites, by their houses and families,
verses.textLa: Tolle summam filiorum Caath de medio Levitarum per domos et familias suas,

verses.textEn: from thirty years and above, even to the fiftieth year, of all who enter so as to stand and minister in the tabernacle of the covenant.
verses.textLa: a trigesimo anno et supra, usque ad quinquagesimum annum, omnium qui ingrediuntur ut stent et ministrent in tabernaculo fœderis.

verses.textEn: This is the service of the sons of Kohath: the tabernacle of the covenant and the Holy of holies.
verses.textLa: Hic est cultus filiorum Caath: Tabernaculum fœderis, et Sanctum sanctorum

verses.textEn: Aaron and his sons shall enter, when the camp is going to move, and they shall take down the veil, which hangs before the entrance, and they shall wrap the ark of the testimony in it,
verses.textLa: ingredientur Aaron et filii eius, quando movenda sunt castra, et deponent velum quod pendet ante fores, involventque eo arcam testimonii,

verses.textEn: and they shall cover it further with a veil of violet skins, and they shall extend over it a cloth made entirely of hyacinth, and they shall draw in the bars.
verses.textLa: et operient rursum velamine ianthinarum pellium, extendentque desuper pallium totum hyacinthinum, et inducent vectes.
verses.notes: The word ‘ianthinarum’ certainly signifies a different color than ‘hyacinthinum.’ The former also appears to be the natural color of the skins (type of skins is unknown), whereas the hyacinth color was most likely derived from the flower so as to dye a cloth (perhaps silk).

verses.textEn: Likewise, they shall wrap the table of the presence in a cloth of hyacinth, and they shall place with it the censers and little mortars, the cups and bowls for pouring out libations; the bread shall be always on it.
verses.textLa: Mensam quoque propositionis involvent hyacinthino pallio, et ponent cum ea thuribula et mortariola, cyathos et crateras ad liba fundenda: panes semper in ea erunt:

verses.textEn: And they shall extend over it a cloth of scarlet, which they shall further cover with a veil of violet skins, and they shall draw in the bars.
verses.textLa: extendentque desuper pallium coccineum, quod rursum operient velamento ianthinarum pellium, et inducent vectes.

verses.textEn: They shall take also a cloth of hyacinth, with which they shall cover the lampstand with the lamps, and its tongs, and the candle snuffers, and all the vessels of oil, which are necessary for the preparation of the lamps.
verses.textLa: Sument et pallium hyacinthinum quo operient candelabrum cum lucernis et forcipibus suis et emunctoriis et cunctis vasis olei, quæ ad cocinnandas lucernas necessaria sunt:

verses.textEn: And over all this they shall place a covering of violet skins, and they shall draw in the bars.
verses.textLa: et super omnia ponent operimentum ianthinarum pellium, et inducent vectes.

verses.textEn: And certainly they shall wrap the golden altar in a hyacinth garment, and they shall extend over it a covering of violet skins, and they shall draw in the bars.
verses.textLa: Nec non et altare aureum involvent hyacinthino vestimento, et extendent desuper operimentum ianthinarum pellium, inducentque vectes.

verses.textEn: All the vessels with which they minister in the Sanctuary they shall wrap in a cloth of hyacinth, and they shall extend over it a covering of violet skins, and they shall draw in the bars.
verses.textLa: Omnia vasa, quibus ministratur in Sanctuario, involvent hyacinthino pallio, et extendent desuper operimentum ianthinarum pellium, inducentque vectes.

verses.textEn: Moreover, they shall cleanse the altar of ashes, and they shall wrap it in a purple garment,
verses.textLa: Sed et altare mundabunt cinere, et involvent illud purpureo vestimento,

verses.textEn: and they shall place it with all the vessels which they use in its ministry, that is, receptacles for fire, small hooks as well as forks, larger hooks and shovels. They shall cover all the vessels of the altar together with a veil of violet skins, and they shall draw in the bars.
verses.textLa: ponentque cum eo omnia vasa, quibus in ministerio eius utuntur, id est, ignium receptacula, fuscinulas ac tridentes, uncinos et batilla. Cuncta vasa altaris operient simul velamine ianthinarum pellium, et inducent vectes.

verses.textEn: And when Aaron and his sons have wrapped the Sanctuary and its vessels at the dismantling of the camp, then the sons of Kohath shall enter, so as to carry what has been wrapped. And they shall not touch the vessels of the Sanctuary, lest they die. These are the burdens of the sons of Kohath concerning the tabernacle of the covenant.
verses.textLa: Cumque involverint Aaron et filii eius Sanctuarium et omnia vasa eius in commotione castrorum, tunc intrabunt filii Caath ut portent involuta: et non tangent vasa Sanctuarii, ne moriantur. Ista sunt onera filiorum Caath in tabernaculo fœderis:

verses.textEn: Over them shall be Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, to whom belongs the care of the oil to prepare the lamps, and the incense compound, and the sacrifice, which is offered continually, and the oil of unction, and whatever pertains to the service of the tabernacle, and all the vessels that are in the Sanctuary.”
verses.textLa: super quos erit Eleazar filius Aaron sacerdotis, ad cuius curam pertinet oleum ad concinnandas lucernas, et compositionis incensum, et sacrificium, quod semper offertur, et oleum unctionis, et quidquid ad cultum tabernaculi pertinet, omniumque vasorum, quæ in Sanctuario sunt.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen et Aaron, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Do not be willing to lose the people of Kohath from the midst of the Levites.
verses.textLa: Nolite perdere populum Caath de medio Levitarum:

verses.textEn: But do this for them, so that they may live, and so that they may not die by touching the Holies of holies. Aaron and his sons shall enter, and they shall assign the work of each one, and they shall determine what each one ought to carry.
verses.textLa: sed hoc facite eis, ut vivant, et non moriantur, si tetigerint Sancta sanctorum. Aaron et filii eius intrabunt, ipsique disponent opera singulorum, et divident quid portare quis debeat.

verses.textEn: Let no others, out of curiosity, see the things that are in the Sanctuary before they are wrapped, otherwise they shall die.”
verses.textLa: Alii nulla curiositate videant quæ sunt in Sanctuario priusquam involvantur, alioquin morientur.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Now also take a total of the sons of Gershon, by their houses and families and kinships,
verses.textLa: Tolle summam etiam filiorum Gerson per domos ac familias et cognationes suas,

verses.textEn: from thirty years and above, even to fifty years. Number all those who enter and minister in the tabernacle of the covenant.
verses.textLa: a triginta annis et supra, usque ad annos quinquaginta. Numera omnes qui ingrediuntur et ministrant in tabernaculo fœderis.

verses.textEn: This is the duty of the family of the Gershonites:
verses.textLa: Hoc est officium familiæ Gersonitarum,

verses.textEn: to carry the curtains of the tabernacle, and the roof of the covenant, the other covering, and the veil over everything, and the violet tent, which hangs at the entrance of the tabernacle of the covenant,
verses.textLa: ut portent cortinas tabernaculi et tectum fœderis operimentum aliud, et super omnia velamen ianthinum tentoriumque quod pendet in introitu tabernaculi fœderis,

verses.textEn: the curtains of the atrium, and the veil at the entrance, which is before tabernacle. Everything that pertains to the altar, the cords, and the vessels of the ministry
verses.textLa: cortinas atrii, et velum in introitu quod est ante tabernaculum. Omnia quæ ad altare pertinent funiculos, et vasa ministerii,

verses.textEn: the sons of Gershon shall carry, under the orders of Aaron and his sons. And so shall each one know to which burden he ought to surrender.
verses.textLa: iubente Aaron et filiis eius, portabunt filii Gerson: et scient singuli cui debeant oneri mancipari.

verses.textEn: This is the service of the family of the Gershonites, in the tabernacle of the covenant, and they shall be under the hand of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.textLa: Hic est cultus familiæ Gersonitarum in tabernaculo fœderis, eruntque sub manu Ithamar filii Aaron sacerdotis.

verses.textEn: Likewise, you shall take a census of the sons of Merari, by the families and houses of their fathers,
verses.textLa: Filios quoque Merari per familias et domos patrum suorum recensebis

verses.textEn: from thirty years and above, even to fifty years, of all who enter to the office of their ministry and to the service of the covenant of the testimony.
verses.textLa: a triginta annis et supra, usque ad annos quinquaginta, omnes qui ingrediuntur ad officium ministerii sui et cultum fœderis testimonii.

verses.textEn: These are their burdens: They shall carry the panels of the tabernacle and its bars, the columns and their bases,
verses.textLa: Hæc sunt onera eorum: Portabunt tabulas tabernaculi et vectes eius, columnas ac bases earum,

verses.textEn: also the columns surrounding the atrium, with their bases and tent pegs and cords. They shall accept by number all the vessels and articles, and so shall they carry them.
verses.textLa: columnas quoque atrii per circuitum cum basibus et paxillis et funibus suis. Omnia vasa et supellectilem ad numerum accipient, sicque portabunt.

verses.textEn: This is the office of the family of the Merarites, and their ministry for the tabernacle of the covenant. And they shall be under the hand of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.”
verses.textLa: Hoc est officium familiæ Meraritarum et ministerium in tabernaculo fœderis: eruntque sub manu Ithamar filii Aaron sacerdotis.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Moses and Aaron, and the leaders of the assembly, took a census of the sons of Kohath, by the kinships and houses of their fathers,
verses.textLa: Recensuerunt igitur Moyses et Aaron et principes synagogæ filios Caath per cognationes et domos patrum suorum

verses.textEn: from thirty years and above, even to the fiftieth year, of all who enter to the ministry of the tabernacle of the covenant.
verses.textLa: a triginta annis et supra, usque ad annum quinquagesimum, omnes qui ingrediuntur ad ministerium tabernaculi fœderis:

verses.textEn: And there were found two thousand seven hundred fifty.
verses.textLa: et inventi sunt duo millia septingenti quinquaginta.

verses.textEn: This is the number of the people of Kohath, who enter the tabernacle of the covenant. These Moses and Aaron numbered according to the word of the Lord by the hand of Moses.
verses.textLa: Hic est numerus populi Caath qui intrant tabernaculum fœderis: hos numeravit Moyses et Aaron iuxta sermonem Domini per manum Moysi.

verses.textEn: The sons of Gershon also were numbered by the kinships and houses of their fathers,
verses.textLa: Numerati sunt et filii Gerson per cognationes et domos patrum suorum,

verses.textEn: from thirty years and above, even to the fiftieth year, all who enter so as to minister in the tabernacle of the covenant.
verses.textLa: a triginta annos et supra, usque ad quinquagesimum annum, omnes qui ingrediuntur ut ministrent in tabernaculo fœderis:

verses.textEn: And there were found two thousand six hundred thirty.
verses.textLa: et inventi sunt duo millia sexcenti triginta.

verses.textEn: This is the people of the Gershonites, whom Moses and Aaron numbered according to the word of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Hic est populus Gersonitarum, quos numeraverunt Moyses et Aaron iuxta verbum Domini.

verses.textEn: The sons of Merari also were numbered by the kinships and houses of their fathers,
verses.textLa: Numerati sunt et filii Merari per cognationes et domos patrum suorum,

verses.textEn: from thirty years and above, even to the fiftieth year, all who enter to fulfill the rituals of the tabernacle of the covenant.
verses.textLa: a triginta annis et supra, usque ad annum quinquagesimum, omnes qui ingrediuntur ad explendos ritus tabernaculi fœderis:

verses.textEn: And there were found three thousand two hundred.
verses.textLa: et inventi sunt tria millia ducenti.

verses.textEn: This is the number of the sons of Merari, whom Moses and Aaron counted according to the command of the Lord by the hand of Moses.
verses.textLa: Hic est numerus filiorum Merari, quos recensuerunt Moyses et Aaron iuxta imperium Domini per manum Moysi.

verses.textEn: All who were counted from the Levites, and whom, by name, Moses and Aaron, and the leaders of Israel, counted by the kinships and houses of their fathers,
verses.textLa: Omnes qui recensiti sunt de Levitis, et quos recenseri fecit ad nomen Moyses et Aaron, et principes Israel per cognationes et domos patrum suorum,

verses.textEn: from thirty years and above, until the fiftieth year, entering for the ministry of the tabernacle and carrying the burdens,
verses.textLa: a triginta annis et supra, usque ad annum quinquagesimum, ingredientes ad ministerium tabernaculi, et onera portanda,

verses.textEn: were together eight thousand five hundred eighty.
verses.textLa: fuerunt simul octo millia quingenti octoginta.

verses.textEn: Moses took a census of them, according to the word of the Lord, each one according to their office and their burdens, just as the Lord had instructed him.
verses.textLa: Iuxta verbum Domini recensuit eos Moyses, unumquemque iuxta officium et onera sua, sicut præceperat ei Dominus.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Instruct the sons of Israel to cast out of the camp every leper, and those who have a flow of seed, and those who have been polluted because of the dead;
verses.textLa: Præcipe filiis Israel, ut eiiciant de castris omnem leprosum, et qui semine fluit, pollutusque est super mortuo:

verses.textEn: cast out of the camp both male and female, lest they contaminate it while I am dwelling with you.”
verses.textLa: tam masculum quam feminam eiicite de castris, ne contaminent ea cum habitaverint vobiscum.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Israel did so, and they cast them out, beyond the camp, just as the Lord had spoken to Moses.
verses.textLa: Feceruntque ita filii Israel, et eiecerunt eos extra castra, sicut locutus erat Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Say to the sons of Israel: A man or a woman, when they have done anything out of all the sins that often befall men, or if, by negligence, they have transgressed the commandment of the Lord, and so have committed an offense,
verses.textLa: Loquere ad filios Israel: Vir, sive mulier, cum fecerint ex omnibus peccatis, quæ solent hominibus accidere, et per negligentiam transgressi fuerint mandatum Domini, atque deliquerint,

verses.textEn: they shall confess their sin, and they shall restore the principle itself, plus a fifth part above it, to any against whom they have sinned.
verses.textLa: confitebuntur peccatum suum, et reddent ipsum caput, quintamque partem desuper ei, in quem peccaverint.

verses.textEn: But if there would be no one to receive it, they shall give it to the Lord, and it shall be for the priest, except for the ram, which is offered for expiation, in order to be a pleasing victim.
verses.textLa: Sin autem non fuerit qui recipiat, dabunt Domino, et erit sacerdotis, excepto ariete, qui offertur pro expiatione, ut sit placabilis hostia.

verses.textEn: Likewise, all the first-fruits, which the sons of Israel offer, belong to the priest,
verses.textLa: Omnes quoque primitiæ, quas offerunt filii Israel, ad sacerdotem pertinent:

verses.textEn: with whatever is offered by each one at the Sanctuary, and which is delivered into the hands of the priest; it shall be his.”
verses.textLa: et quidquid in Sanctuarium offertur a singulis, et traditur manibus sacerdotis, ipsius erit.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Speak to the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: The man whose wife will have gone astray, and, disdaining her husband,
verses.textLa: Loquere ad filios Israel, et dices ad eos: Vir, cuius uxor erraverit, maritumque contemnens

verses.textEn: will have slept with another man, and if her husband cannot discover it, but the adultery is secret, and if it cannot be proved by witnesses, because she was not caught in the shameful act,
verses.textLa: dormierit cum altero viro, et hoc maritus deprehendere non quiverit, sed latet adulterium, et testibus argui non potest, quia non est inventa in stupro:

verses.textEn: if the spirit of jealousy stirs up the husband against his wife, who either has been polluted or is being assailed with a false suspicion,
verses.textLa: si spiritus zelotypiæ concitaverit virum contra uxorem suam, quæ vel polluta est, vel falsa suspicione appetitur,
verses.notes: The wife may be guilty, in which case she has been defiled by her act, or she may be innocent, in which case it is a false accusation.

verses.textEn: he shall bring her to the priest, and he shall offer an oblation for her, a tenth part of native barley meal. He shall not pour oil over it, nor shall he place frankincense on it, because it is a sacrifice for jealousy, or an oblation investigating adultery.
verses.textLa: adducet eam ad sacerdotem, et offeret oblationem pro illa decimam partem sati farinæ hordeaceæ: non fundet super eam oleum, nec imponet thus: quia sacrificium zelotypiæ est, et oblatio investigans adulterium.
verses.notes: The word ‘siti’ can refer to something grown natively, or to something sprouting. The phrasing ‘native barley meal’ is probably a better translation than ‘sprouted barley meal.’

verses.textEn: Therefore, the priest shall offer it, and he shall set it in the sight of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Offeret igitur eam sacerdos, et statuet coram Domino.

verses.textEn: And he shall take up holy water in an earthen vessel, and he shall cast a little earth from the pavement of the tabernacle into it.
verses.textLa: Assumetque aquam sanctam in vase fictili, et pauxillum terræ de pavimento tabernaculi mittet in eam.

verses.textEn: And while the woman stands before the Lord, he shall uncover her head, and he shall place over her hands the sacrifice of recollection and oblation of jealousy. But he shall take hold of the most bitter waters, in which he has gathered curses with loathing.
verses.textLa: Cumque steterit mulier in conspectu Domini, discooperiet caput eius, et ponet super manus illius sacrificium recordationis, et oblationem zelotypiæ: ipse autem tenebit aquas amarissimas, in quibus cum execratione maledicta congessit.

verses.textEn: And he shall bind her by an oath, and he shall say: ‘If another man has not slept with you, and if you have not been polluted by forsaking the bed of your husband, these most bitter waters, into which I have gathered curses, shall not harm you.
verses.textLa: Adiurabitque eam, et dicet: Si non dormivit vir alienus tecum, et si non polluta es deserto mariti thoro, non te nocebunt aquæ istæ amarissimæ, in quas maledicta congessi.

verses.textEn: But if you have turned away from your husband, and also have been defiled, and have lain together with another man,
verses.textLa: Sin autem declinasti a viro tuo, atque polluta es, et concubuisti cum altero viro:

verses.textEn: these curses shall be thrown upon you: May the Lord turn you into a curse and an example among all his people. May he cause your thigh to rot, and may your abdomen swell up and burst out.
verses.textLa: his maledictionibus subiacebis: Det te Dominus in maledictionem, exemplumque cunctorum in populo suo: putrescere faciat femur tuum, et tumens uterus tuus disrumpatur.

verses.textEn: May the cursed waters enter into your stomach, and may your womb swell and your thigh rot.’ And the woman shall respond: ‘Amen, amen.’
verses.textLa: Ingrediantur aquæ maledictæ in ventrem tuum, et utero tumescente putrescat femur. Et respondebit mulier: Amen, amen.

verses.textEn: And the priest shall write these curses in a little book, and then he shall erase them with the very bitter waters, into which he had gathered the curses,
verses.textLa: Scribetque sacerdos in libello ista maledicta, et delebit ea aquis amarissimis, in quas maledicta congessit,

verses.textEn: and he shall give it to her to drink. And when she has emptied it,
verses.textLa: et dabit ei bibere. Quas cum exhauserit,

verses.textEn: the priest shall take from her hand the sacrifice of jealousy, and he shall elevate it before the Lord, and he shall impose it upon the altar. Yet only after he first
verses.textLa: tollet sacerdos de manu eius sacrificium zelotypiæ, et elevabit illud coram Domino, imponetque illud super altare: ita dumtaxat ut prius,

verses.textEn: takes a handful of the sacrifice from that which is offered, and burns it upon the altar, and then he may give the most bitter waters to the woman as a drink.
verses.textLa: pugillum sacrificii tollat de eo, quod offertur, et incendat super altare: et sic potum det mulieri aquas amarissimas.

verses.textEn: And when she drinks it, if she has been defiled, and, having despised her husband, is guilty of adultery, the curse shall pass through her, and as her belly swells up, her thigh shall decay, and the woman shall become a curse and an example to all the people.
verses.textLa: Quas cum biberit, si polluta est, et contempto viro adulterii rea, pertransibunt eam aquæ maledictionis, et inflato ventre computrescet femur: eritque mulier in maledictionem, et in exemplum omni populo.

verses.textEn: But if she has not been defiled, she shall be unharmed and she shall bear children.
verses.textLa: Quod si polluta non fuerit, erit innoxia, et faciet liberos.

verses.textEn: This is the law for jealousy. If a woman has turned aside from her husband, and if she has been polluted,
verses.textLa: Ista est lex zelotypiæ. Si declinaverit mulier a viro suo, et si polluta fuerit,

verses.textEn: and if the husband, being stirred up by the spirit of jealousy, has brought her before the sight of the Lord, and the priest has acted toward her according to all that has been written:
verses.textLa: maritusque zelotypiæ spiritu concitatus adduxerit eam in conspectu Domini, et fecerit ei sacerdos iuxta omnia quæ scripta sunt:

verses.textEn: then the husband shall be without guilt, and she shall bear her iniquity.”
verses.textLa: maritus absque culpa erit, et illa recipiet iniquitatem suam.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Speak to the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: A man or a woman, when they have made a vow so that they may be sanctified, and when they are willing to consecrate themselves to the Lord,
verses.textLa: Loquere ad filios Israel, et dices ad eos: Vir, sive mulier, cum fecerint votum ut sanctificentur, et se voluerint Domino consecrare:

verses.textEn: shall abstain from wine and from anything which is able to inebriate. They shall not drink vinegar made from wine or from any other drink, nor anything pressed from the grape. They shall not eat grapes, neither fresh nor dried.
verses.textLa: a vino, et omni, quod inebriare potest, abstinebunt. Acetum ex vino, et ex qualibet alia potione, et quidquid de uva exprimitur, non bibent: uvas recentes siccasque non comedent

verses.textEn: During all the days that they are consecrated to the Lord by vow, they shall not eat whatever may be from the vineyard, from raisins, even to grape seeds.
verses.textLa: cunctis diebus quibus ex voto Domino consecrantur: quidquid ex vinea esse potest, ab uva passa usque ad acinum non comedent.

verses.textEn: During all the time of his separation, no razor shall pass over his head, even until the completion of the day when he is consecrated to the Lord. He shall be holy, letting the hair of his head grow long.
verses.textLa: Omni tempore separationis suæ novacula non transibit per caput eius usque ad completum diem, quo Domino consecratur. Sanctus erit, crescente cæsarie capitis eius.

verses.textEn: During all the time of his consecration, he shall not enter because of a death,
verses.textLa: Omni tempore consecrationis suæ super mortuum non ingredietur,

verses.textEn: nor shall he contaminate himself, even over the funeral of his father, or his mother, or his brother, or his sister. For the consecration of his God is upon his head.
verses.textLa: nec super patris quidem et matris et fratris sororisque funere contaminabitur, quia consecratio Dei sui super caput eius est.

verses.textEn: During all the days of his separation, he shall be holy to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Omnibus diebus separationis suæ sanctus erit Domino.

verses.textEn: But if anyone will have died unexpectedly before him, the head of his consecration shall be polluted, and he shall shave it in that very place, on the same day of his purification, and again on the seventh day.
verses.textLa: Sin autem mortuus fuerit subito quispiam coram eo, polluetur caput consecrationis eius: quod radet illico in eadem die purgationis suæ, et rursum septima.

verses.textEn: Then, on the eighth day, he shall offer two turtledoves or two young pigeons, to the priest at the entrance to the covenant of the testimony.
verses.textLa: In octava autem die offeret duos turtures, vel duos pullos columbæ sacerdoti in introitu fœderis testimonii.

verses.textEn: And the priest shall effect one for sin, and the other as a holocaust, and he shall pray for him, because he has sinned on account of the dead. And he shall sanctify his head on that day.
verses.textLa: facietque sacerdos unum pro peccato, et alterum in holocaustum, et deprecabitur pro eo, quia peccavit super mortuo: sanctificabitque caput eius in die illo:

verses.textEn: And he shall consecrate to the Lord the days of his separation, offering a one-year-old lamb for sin, yet in such a manner that the former days will be made null and void, because his sanctification was polluted.
verses.textLa: et consecrabit Domino dies separationis illius, offerens agnum anniculum pro peccato: ita tamen ut dies priores irriti fiant, quoniam polluta est sanctificatio eius.

verses.textEn: This is the law of consecration. When the days that he had decreed by vow have been completed, he shall bring him to the door of the tabernacle of the covenant,
verses.textLa: Ista est lex consecrationis. Cum dies, quos ex voto decreverat, complebuntur: adducet eum ad ostium tabernaculi fœderis,

verses.textEn: and he shall offer his oblation to the Lord: an immaculate one-year-old male lamb as a holocaust, and an immaculate one-year-old female lamb for sin, and an immaculate ram, a peace-offering victim,
verses.textLa: et offeret oblationes eius Domino, agnum anniculum immaculatum in holocaustum, et ovem anniculam immaculatam pro peccato, et arietem immaculatum, hostiam pacificam,

verses.textEn: also, a basket of unleavened bread, which has been sprinkled with oil, and cakes without leaven, anointed with oil, as well as the libations of each one.
verses.textLa: canistrum quoque panum azymorum qui conspersi sint oleo, et lagana absque fermento uncta oleo, ac libamina singulorum:

verses.textEn: And the priest shall offer them before the Lord, and he shall perform both the sin offering and the holocaust.
verses.textLa: quæ offeret sacerdos coram Domino, et faciet tam pro peccato, quam in holocaustum.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the ram he shall immolate as a peace-offering victim to the Lord, offering at the same time the basket of unleavened bread, and the libations which are required by custom.
verses.textLa: Arietem vero immolabit hostiam pacificam Domino, offerens simul canistrum azymorum, et libamenta quæ ex more debentur.

verses.textEn: Then the Nazarite shall be shaved of the long hair of his consecration, before the door of the tabernacle of the covenant. And he shall take his hair, and he shall place it upon the fire, which is under the sacrifice of the peace offerings.
verses.textLa: Tunc radetur nazaræus ante ostium tabernaculi fœderis cæsarie consecrationis suæ: tolletque capillos eius, et ponet super ignem, qui est suppositus sacrificio pacificorum.

verses.textEn: And he shall take the cooked shoulder of the ram, and one twist of bread without leaven from the basket, and one unleavened cake, and he shall deliver them into the hands of the Nazarite, after his head has been shaven.
verses.textLa: Et armum coctum arietis, tortamque absque fermento unam de canistro, et laganum azymum unum, et tradet in manus Nazaræi, postquam rasum fuerit caput eius.

verses.textEn: And receiving them again from him, he shall elevate them in the sight of the Lord. And having been sanctified, these shall be for the priest, as also the breast, which was ordered to be separated, and the leg. After this, the Nazarite is able to drink wine.
verses.textLa: Susceptaque rursum ab eo, elevabit in conspectu Domini: et sanctificata sacerdotis erunt, sicut pectusculum, quod separari iussum est, et femur. Post hæc, potest bibere Nazaræus vinum.

verses.textEn: This is the law of the Nazarite, when he has vowed his oblation to the Lord in the time of his consecration, aside from those things which his hand shall find. According to what he had vowed in his mind, so shall he do, to the perfection of his sanctification.”
verses.textLa: Ista est lex Nazaræi, cum voverit oblationem suam Domino tempore consecrationis suæ, exceptis his, quæ invenerit manus eius. Iuxta quod mente devoverat, ita faciet ad perfectionem sanctificationis suæ.
verses.notes: Vows are of the mind and soul ‘mente devoverat.’ The vows of priests and religious assist in their sanctification, even toward the goal of becoming perfect as Christ is perfect.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Say to Aaron and his sons: Thus shall you bless the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them:
verses.textLa: Loquere Aaron et filiis eius: Sic benedicetis filiis Israel, et dicetis eis:

verses.textEn: ‘May the Lord bless you and keep you.
verses.textLa: Benedicat tibi Dominus, et custodiat te.

verses.textEn: May the Lord reveal his face to you and take pity on you.
verses.textLa: Ostendat Dominus faciem suam tibi, et misereatur tui.

verses.textEn: May the Lord turn his countenance toward you and grant peace to you.’
verses.textLa: Convertat Dominus vultum suum ad te, et det tibi pacem.

verses.textEn: And they shall invoke my name over the sons of Israel, and I will bless them.”
verses.textLa: Invocabuntque nomen meum super filios Israel, et ego benedicam eis.

verses.textEn: Now it happened in the day when Moses completed the tabernacle, and he set it up, and he anointed and sanctified it with all of its vessels, and similarly the altar and all of its vessels,
verses.textLa: Factum est autem in die qua complevit Moyses tabernaculum, et erexit illud: unxitque et sanctificavit cum omnibus vasis suis, altare similiter et omnia vasa eius:

verses.textEn: that the leaders of Israel and the heads of the families, who were in each tribe and who were in charge of those who had been numbered, offered
verses.textLa: obtulerunt principes Israel et capita familiarum, qui erant per singulas tribus, præfectique eorum, qui numerati fuerant,

verses.textEn: their gifts in the sight of the Lord: six covered wagons with twelve oxen. Two leaders offered one wagon, and each offered one ox, and they offered these in the sight of the tabernacle.
verses.textLa: munera coram Domino sex plaustra tecta cum duodecim bobus. Unum plaustrum obtulere duo duces, et unum bovem singuli, obtuleruntque ea in conspectu tabernaculi.

verses.textEn: Then the Lord said to Moses:
verses.textLa: Ait autem Dominus ad Moysen:

verses.textEn: “Receive these things from them, in order to serve in the ministry of the tabernacle, and you shall deliver them to the Levites, according to the order of their ministry.”
verses.textLa: Suscipe ab eis ut serviant in ministerio tabernaculi, et trades ea Levitis iuxta ordinem ministerii sui.

verses.textEn: And so Moses, having received the wagons and the oxen, delivered them to the Levites.
verses.textLa: Itaque cum suscepisset Moyses plaustra et boves, tradidit eos Levitis.

verses.textEn: Two wagons and four oxen he gave to the sons of Gershon, according to what they needed.
verses.textLa: Duo plaustra et quattuor boves dedit filiis Gerson, iuxta id quod habebant necessarium.

verses.textEn: The other four wagons and eight oxen he gave to the sons of Merari, according to their offices and service, under the hand of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.
verses.textLa: Quattuor alia plaustra, et octo boves dedit filiis Merari secundum officia et cultum suum, sub manu Ithamar filii Aaron sacerdotis.

verses.textEn: But to the sons of Kohath he gave no wagons or oxen, because they serve in the Sanctuary and they carry their burdens on their shoulders.
verses.textLa: Filiis autem Caath non dedit plaustra et boves: quia in Sanctuario serviunt, et onera propriis portant humeris.
verses.notes: The sons of Kohath were permitted to enter the Sanctuary, after all the articles had been wrapped, so as to carry these when the camp moved. They carried the ark of the covenant on their shoulders, by means of the gold covered bars.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the leaders offered, at the dedication of the altar on the day when it was anointed, their oblation before the altar.
verses.textLa: Igitur obtulerunt duces in dedicationem altaris, die qua unctum est, oblationem suam ante altare.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to Moses: “Let each of the leaders, on each of the days, offer their gifts for the dedication of the altar.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Singuli duces per singulos dies offerant munera in dedicationem altaris.

verses.textEn: On the first day, Nahshon, the son of Amminadab of the tribe of Judah, offered his oblation.
verses.textLa: Primo die obtulit oblationem suam Nahasson filius Aminadab de tribu Iuda:

verses.textEn: And in it were these: a silver dish weighing one hundred thirty shekels, a silver bowl having seventy shekels, according to the weight of the Sanctuary, and both were filled with fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil as a sacrifice,
verses.textLa: fueruntque in ea acetabulum argenteum pondo centum triginta siclorum, phiala argentea habens septuaginta siclos iuxta pondus Sanctuarii, utrumque plenum simila conspersa oleo in sacrificium:

verses.textEn: a little mortar made from ten shekels of gold, filled with incense,
verses.textLa: mortariolum ex decem siclis aureis plenum incenso:

verses.textEn: an ox from the herd, and a ram, and a one-year-old lamb as a holocaust,
verses.textLa: bovem de armento, et arietem, et agnum anniculum in holocaustum:

verses.textEn: and a he-goat for sin;
verses.textLa: hircumque pro peccato:

verses.textEn: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five one-year-old lambs. This was the oblation of Nahshon, the son of Amminadab.
verses.textLa: et in sacrificio pacificorum boves duos, arietes quinque, hircos quinque, agnos anniculos quinque. Hæc est oblatio Nahasson filii Aminadab.

verses.textEn: On the second day, Nathanael, the son of Zuar, the leader of the tribe of Issachar, offered:
verses.textLa: Secundo die obtulit Nathanael filius Suar, dux de tribu Issachar,

verses.textEn: a silver dish weighing one hundred thirty shekels, a silver bowl having seventy shekels, according to the weight of the Sanctuary, and both were filled with fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil as a sacrifice,
verses.textLa: acetabulum argenteum appendens centum triginta siclos, phialam argenteam habentem septuaginta siclos, iuxta pondus Sanctuarii, utrumque plenum simila conspersa oleo in sacrificium:

verses.textEn: a little mortar of gold having ten shekels, filled with incense,
verses.textLa: mortariolum aureum habens decem siclos plenum incenso:

verses.textEn: an ox from the herd, and a ram, and one-year-old lamb as a holocaust,
verses.textLa: bovem de armento, et arietem, et agnum anniculum in holocaustum:

verses.textEn: and a he-goat for sin;
verses.textLa: hircumque pro peccato:

verses.textEn: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five one-year-old lambs. This was the oblation of Nathanael, the son of Zuar.
verses.textLa: et in sacrificio pacificorum boves duos, arietes quinque, hircos quinque, agnos anniculos quinque. Hæc fuit oblatio Nathanael filii Suar.

verses.textEn: On the third day, the leader of the sons of Zebulon, Eliab the son of Helon,
verses.textLa: Tertio die princeps filiorum Zabulon Eliab filius Helon,

verses.textEn: offered a silver dish weighing one hundred thirty shekels, a silver bowl having seventy shekels, by the weight of the Sanctuary, and both were filled with fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil as a sacrifice,
verses.textLa: obtulit acetabulum argenteum appendens centum triginta siclos, phialam argenteam habentem septuaginta siclos ad pondus Sanctuarii, utrumque plenum similia conspersa oleo in sacrificium:

verses.textEn: a little mortar of gold weighing ten shekels, filled with incense,
verses.textLa: mortariolum aureum appendens decem siclos plenum incenso:

verses.textEn: an ox from the herd, and a ram, and one-year-old lamb as a holocaust,
verses.textLa: bovem de armento, et arietem, et agnum anniculum in holocaustum:

verses.textEn: and a he-goat for sin;
verses.textLa: hircumque pro peccato:

verses.textEn: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five one-year-old lambs. This is the oblation of Eliab the son of Helon.
verses.textLa: et in sacrificio pacificorum boves duos, arietes quinque, hircos quinque, agnos anniculos quinque. Hæc est oblatio Eliab filii Helon.

verses.textEn: On the fourth day, the leader of the sons of Ruben, Elizur the son of Shedeur,
verses.textLa: Die quarto princeps filiorum Ruben, Elisur filius Sedeur,

verses.textEn: offered a silver dish weighing one hundred thirty shekels, a silver bowl having seventy shekels, by the weight of the Sanctuary, and both were filled with fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil as a sacrifice,
verses.textLa: obtulit acetabulum argenteum appendens centum triginta siclos, phialam argenteam habentem septuaginta siclos ad pondus Sanctuarii, utrumque plenum simila conspersa oleo in sacrificum:

verses.textEn: a little mortar of gold weighing ten shekels, filled with incense,
verses.textLa: mortariolum aureum appendens decem siclos plenum incenso:

verses.textEn: an ox from the herd, and a ram, and a one-year-old lamb as a holocaust,
verses.textLa: bovem de armento, et arietem, et agnum anniculum in holocaustum:

verses.textEn: and a he-goat for sin;
verses.textLa: hircumque pro peccato:

verses.textEn: and for victims of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five one-year-old lambs. This was the oblation of Elizur, the son of Shedeur.
verses.textLa: et in hostias pacificorum boves duos, arietes quinque, hircos quinque, agnos anniculos quinque. Hæc fuit oblatio Elisur filii Sedeur.

verses.textEn: On the fifth day, the leader of the sons of Simeon, Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai,
verses.textLa: Die quinto princeps filiorum Simeon Salamiel filius Surisaddai

verses.textEn: offered a silver dish weighing one hundred thirty shekels, a silver bowl having seventy shekels, by the weight of the Sanctuary, and both were filled with fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil as a sacrifice,
verses.textLa: obtulit acetabulum argenteum appendens centum triginta siclos, phialam argenteam habentem septuaginta siclos ad pondus Sanctuarii, utrumque plenum simila conspersa oleo in sacrificum:

verses.textEn: a little mortar of gold weighing ten shekels, filled with incense,
verses.textLa: mortariolum aureum appendens decem siclos plenum incenso:

verses.textEn: an ox from the herd, and a ram, and a one-year-old lamb as a holocaust,
verses.textLa: bovem de armento, et arietem, et agnum anniculum in holocaustum:

verses.textEn: and a he-goat for sin;
verses.textLa: hircumque pro peccato:

verses.textEn: and for victims of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five one-year-old lambs. This was the oblation of Shelumiel, the son of Zurishaddai.
verses.textLa: et in hostias pacificorum boves duos, arietes quinque, hircos quinque, agnos anniculos quinque. Hæc fuit oblatio Salamiel filii Surisaddai.

verses.textEn: On the sixth day, the leader of the sons of Gad, Eliasaph the son of Reuel,
verses.textLa: Die sexto princeps filiorum Gad, Eliasaph filius Duel

verses.textEn: offered a silver dish weighing one hundred thirty shekels, a silver bowl having seventy shekels, by the weight of the Sanctuary, and both were filled with fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil as a sacrifice,
verses.textLa: obtulit acetabulum argenteum appendens centum triginta siclos, phialam argenteam habentem septuaginta siclos ad pondus Sanctuarii, utrumque plenum simila conspersa oleo in sacrificum:

verses.textEn: a little mortar of gold weighing ten shekels, filled with incense,
verses.textLa: mortariolum aureum appendens decem siclos plenum incenso:

verses.textEn: an ox from the herd, and a ram, and one-year-old lamb as a holocaust,
verses.textLa: bovem de armento, et arietem, et agnum anniculum in holocaustum:

verses.textEn: and a he-goat for sin;
verses.textLa: hircumque pro peccato:

verses.textEn: and for victims of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five one-year-old lambs. This was the oblation of Eliasaph, the son of Reuel.
verses.textLa: et in hostias pacificorum boves duos, arietes quinque, hircos quinque, agnos anniculos quinque. Hæc fuit oblatio Eliasaph filii Duel.

verses.textEn: On the seventh day, the leader of the sons of Ephraim, Elishama the son of Ammihud,
verses.textLa: Die septimo princeps filiorum Ephraim, Elisama filius Ammiud

verses.textEn: offered a silver dish weighing one hundred thirty shekels, a silver bowl having seventy shekels, by the weight of the Sanctuary, and both were filled with fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil as a sacrifice,
verses.textLa: obtulit acetabulum argenteum appendens centum triginta siclos, phialam argenteam habentem septuaginta siclos ad pondus Sanctuarii, utrumque plenum simila conspersa oleo in sacrificum:

verses.textEn: a little mortar of gold weighing ten shekels, filled with incense,
verses.textLa: mortariolum aureum appendens decem siclos plenum incenso:

verses.textEn: an ox from the herd, and a ram, and one-year-old lamb as a holocaust,
verses.textLa: bovem de armento, et arietem, et agnum anniculum in holocaustum:

verses.textEn: and a he-goat for sin;
verses.textLa: hircumque pro peccato:

verses.textEn: and for victims of peace offerings: two oxen, five rams, five he-goats, and five one-year-old lambs. This was the oblation of Elishama, the son of Ammihud.
verses.textLa: et in hostias pacificorum, boves duos, arietes quinque, hircos quinque, agnos anniculos quinque. Hæc fuit oblatio Elisama filii Ammiud.

verses.textEn: On the eighth day, the leader of the sons of Manasseh, Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur,
verses.textLa: Die octavo, princeps filiorum Manasse, Gamaliel filius Phadassur,

verses.textEn: offered a silver dish weighing one hundred thirty shekels, a silver bowl having seventy shekels, by the weight of the Sanctuary, and both were filled with fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil as a sacrifice,
verses.textLa: obtulit acetabulum argenteum appendens centum triginta siclos, phialam argenteam habentem septuaginta siclos ad pondus Sanctuarii, utrumque plenum simila conspersa oleo in sacrificum:

verses.textEn: a little mortar of gold weighing ten shekels, filled with incense,
verses.textLa: mortariolum aureum appendens decem siclos, plenum incenso:

verses.textEn: an ox from the herd, and a ram, and a one-year-old lamb as a holocaust,
