verses.textEn: And Balak, being angry against Balaam, clapped his hands together and said: “I called you to curse my enemies, and, to the contrary, you have blessed them three times.
verses.textLa: Iratusque Balac contra Balaam, complosis manibus ait: Ad maledicendum inimicis meis vocavi te, quibus econtrario tertio benedixisti:

verses.textEn: Return to your place. I had decided, indeed, to honor you greatly, but the Lord has deprived you of the designated honor.”
verses.textLa: revertere ad locum tuum. Decreveram quidem magnifice honorare te, sed Dominus privavit te honore disposito.

verses.textEn: Balaam responded to Balak: “Did I not say to your messengers, whom you sent to me:
verses.textLa: Respondit Balaam ad Balac: Nonne nunciis tuis, quos misisti ad me, dixi:
verses.notes: A question mark is omitted deliberately, because it would be confusing. Also, as a rhetorical question, these two verses are more of a statement than a question.

verses.textEn: Even if Balak would give me his house, filled with silver and gold, I still could not go away from the word of the Lord my God, so as to offer anything, either good or evil, from my own heart; but whatever the Lord will speak, this, too, I shall speak.
verses.textLa: Si dederit mihi Balac: plenam domum suam argenti et auri, non potero præterire sermonem Domini Dei mei, ut vel boni quid, vel mali proferam ex corde meo: sed quidquid Dominus dixerit, hoc loquar?

verses.textEn: Yet truly, as I continue on to my own people, I will give you counsel as to what this people shall do to your people in the end times.”
verses.textLa: Verumtamen pergens ad populum meum, dabo consilium, quid populus tuus populo huic faciat extremo tempore.

verses.textEn: Therefore, taking up his parable, he again spoke: “Balaam the son of Beor, the man whose eye has been obstructed,
verses.textLa: Sumpta igitur parabola, rursum ait: Dixit Balaam filius Beor: dixit homo, cuius obturatus est oculus:

verses.textEn: the hearer of the sermon of God, he who knows the doctrine of the Most High, and who sees the visions of the Almighty, who, falling down, has his eyes opened, has declared:
verses.textLa: dixit auditor sermonum Dei, qui novit doctrinam Altissimi, et visiones Omnipotentis videt, qui cadens apertos habet oculos.

verses.textEn: I shall see him, but not presently. I shall gaze upon him, but not soon. A star shall rise out of Jacob, and a rod shall spring up from Israel. And he shall strike down the commanders of Moab, and he shall devastate all the sons of Seth.
verses.textLa: Videbo eum, sed non modo: intuebor illum, sed non prope. Orietur stella ex Iacob, et consurget virga de Israel: et percutiet duces Moab, vastabitque omnes filios Seth.

verses.textEn: And he shall possess Idumea; the inheritance of Seir shall fall to their enemies. Yet truly, Israel shall act with strength.
verses.textLa: Et erit Idumæa possessio eius: hereditas Seir cedet inimicis suis: Israel vero fortiter aget.

verses.textEn: From Jacob will be he who shall be ruler. And he shall perish the remnants of the city.”
verses.textLa: De Iacob erit qui dominetur. Et perdat reliquias civitatis.

verses.textEn: And when he saw Amalek, taking up his parable, he said: “Amalek, first among the Gentiles, whose very end shall be perdition.”
verses.textLa: Cumque vidisset Amalec, assumens parabolam, ait: Principium Gentium Amalec, cuius extrema perdentur.

verses.textEn: Likewise, he saw the Kainites, and taking up his parable, he said: “Robust, indeed, is your habitation. But though you will set your nest in a rock,
verses.textLa: Vidit quoque Cinæum: et assumpta parabola, ait: Robustum quidem est habitaculum tuum: sed si in petra posueris nidum tuum,
verses.notes: The Kenites figuratively represent certain faithful Roman Catholics during the last days, during the Antichrist’s reign, who make their home in that Rock which is the Church and its teachings.

verses.textEn: and you will be elect among the stock of Kain, how long will you be able to remain? For Assur shall take you captive.”
verses.textLa: et fueris electus de stirpe Cin, quamdiu poteris permanere? Assur enim capiet te.
verses.notes: But these faithful Roman Catholics will be taken captive by Assur (the Antichrist).

verses.textEn: And taking up his parable once more he said: “Alas! Who will be able to survive, when God will do these things?
verses.textLa: Assumptaque parabola iterum locutus est: Heu, quis victurus est, quando ista faciet Deus?

verses.textEn: They shall arrive in Greek warships from Italy. They shall overcome the Assyrians, and they shall devastate the Hebrews, and yet, at the very end, even they themselves shall perish.”
verses.textLa: Venient in Trieribus de Italia, superabunt Assyrios, vastabuntque Hebræos, et ad extremum etiam ipsi peribunt.
verses.notes: Trieres refers to a type of warship made by the Greeks. This passage refers to the same event as Daniel 11:29-30; the middle of the Antichrist’s reign, when some Roman Catholics in Greek warships (i.e. from a democratic or formerly-democratic nation) will come against the fleet of the Antichrist. The reference to Italy has the spiritual meaning of indicating Roman Catholics, because Italy and Rome is the seat of authority of the Church. They shall overcome the Assyrians (the fleet of the Antichrist, who will be from Assyria), and also will devastate the Hebrews. The Hebrews, at that time, will be in support of the Antichrist. But notice that they are called Hebrews, not Jews. Those who are truly devout Jews will reject the Antichrist. Later, when the Antichrist is thrown down by the Archangel Michael, many of these Hebrews repent and believe in Jesus Christ. After the Antichrist is defeated in this battle, at a later time, he discovers which Catholics fought against him there and has them killed.

verses.textEn: And Balaam rose up, and he returned to his place. Likewise, Balak went back, along the way by which he had arrived.
verses.textLa: Surrexitque Balaam, et reversus est in locum suum: Balac quoque via, qua venerat, rediit.

verses.textEn: Now Israel, at that time, dwelt in Shittim, and the people were fornicating with the daughters of Moab,
verses.textLa: Morabatur autem eo tempore Israel in Settim, et fornicatus est populus cum filiabus Moab,

verses.textEn: who called them to their sacrifices. And they ate, and they adored their gods.
verses.textLa: quæ vocaverunt eos ad sacrificia sua. At ille comederunt et adoraverunt deos earum.

verses.textEn: And Israel was initiated into Baal of Peor. And so the Lord, being angry,
verses.textLa: Initiatusque est Israel Beelphegor: et iratus Dominus,

verses.textEn: said to Moses, “Take all the leaders of the people, and hang them on gallows against the sun, so that my fury may be averted from Israel.”
verses.textLa: ait ad Moysen: Tolle cunctos principes populi, et suspende eos contra solem in patibulis: ut avertatur furor meus ab Israel.

verses.textEn: And Moses said to the judges of Israel, “Let each one kill his neighbors, who have been initiated into Baal of Peor.”
verses.textLa: Dixitque Moyses ad iudices Israel: Occidat unusquisque proximos suos, qui initiati sunt Beelphegor.
verses.notes: Notice that Phinehas does not act until after Moses gives the order from God to kill those who were sinning.

verses.textEn: And behold, one of the sons of Israel entered, in the sight of his brothers, to a prostitute of Midian, within view of Moses and of all the crowd of the sons of Israel, who were weeping before the door of the tabernacle.
verses.textLa: Et ecce unus de filiis Israel intravit coram fratribus suis ad scortum Madianitidem, vidente Moyse, et omni turba filiorum Israel, qui flebant ante fores tabernaculi.

verses.textEn: And when Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, had seen it, he rose up from the midst of the multitude, and, seizing a dagger,
verses.textLa: Quod cum vidisset Phinees filius Eleazari filii Aaron sacerdotis, surrexit de medio multitudinis, et arrepto pugione,

verses.textEn: he entered after the Israelite man, into the brothel, and he pierced both of them at the same time, specifically, the man and the woman at the location of their genitals. And the scourge ceased from among the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: ingressus est post virum Israelitem in lupanar, et perfodit ambos simul, virum scilicet et mulierem in locis genitalibus. Cessavitque plaga a filiis Israel:

verses.textEn: And there were slain twenty-four thousand men.
verses.textLa: et occisi sunt viginti quattuor millia hominum.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to Moses:
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen:

verses.textEn: “Phinehas the son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has averted my wrath from the sons of Israel. For he was moved against them by my zeal, so that I myself, in my zeal, might not wipe away the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Phinees filius Eleazari filii Aaron sacerdotis avertit iram meam a filiis Israel: quia zelo meo commotus est contra eos, ut non ipse delerem filios Israel in zelo meo.

verses.textEn: Because of this, say to him: Behold, I give to him the peace of my covenant.
verses.textLa: Idcirco loquere ad eum: Ecce do ei pacem fœderis mei,

verses.textEn: And the covenant of the everlasting priesthood shall be as much for him as for his offspring. For he was zealous on behalf of his God, and he has made expiation for the wickedness of the sons of Israel.”
verses.textLa: et erit tam ipsi quam semini eius pactum sacerdotii sempiternum, quia zelatus est pro Deo suo, et expiavit scelus filiorum Israel.

verses.textEn: Now the name of the Israelite man, who was killed with the Midianite woman, was Zimri the son of Salu, a leader from the kinship and tribe of Simeon.
verses.textLa: Erat autem nomen viri Israelitæ, qui occisus est cum Madianitide, Zambri filius Salu, dux de cognatione et tribu Simeonis.

verses.textEn: Moreover, the Midianite woman, who was put to death together with him, was called Cozbi the daughter of Zur, a most noble leader among the Midianites.
verses.textLa: Porro mulier Madianitis, quæ pariter interfecta est, vocabatur Cozbi filia Sur principis nobilissimi Madianitarum.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Let the Midianites perceive you as enemies, and strike them down,
verses.textLa: Hostes vos sentiant Madianitæ, et percutite eos:

verses.textEn: for they, too, have behaved with hostility against you, and they have deceived you insidiously by means of the idol Peor, and by Cozbi, the daughter of a commander of Midian, their sister, who was struck down in the day of the scourge because of the sacrilege of Peor.”
verses.textLa: quia et ipsi hostiliter egerunt contra vos, et decepere insidiis per idolum Phogor, et Cozbi filiam ducis Madian sororem suam, quæ percussa est in die plagæ pro sacrilegio Phogor.

verses.textEn: After the blood of the guilty was shed, the Lord said to Moses, and to Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest:
verses.textLa: Postquam noxiorum sanguis effusus est, dixit Dominus ad Moysen et Eleazarum filium Aaron sacerdotem:

verses.textEn: “Number the entire sum of the sons of Israel, from twenty years and above, by their houses and kinships, all who are able to go forth to war.”
verses.textLa: Numerate omnem summam filiorum Israel a viginti annis et supra, per domos et cognationes suas, cunctos, qui possunt ad bella procedere.

verses.textEn: And so, Moses and Eleazar the priest, who were in the plains of Moab, above the Jordan, opposite Jericho, spoke to those who were
verses.textLa: Locuti sunt itaque Moyses et Eleazar sacerdos, in campestribus Moab super Iordanem contra Iericho, ad eos, qui erant

verses.textEn: from twenty years and above, just as the Lord had commanded. And this is their number:
verses.textLa: a viginti annis et supra, sicut Dominus imperaverat, quorum iste est numerus:

verses.textEn: Ruben, the firstborn of Israel; his son, Hanoch, from whom is the family of the Hanochites; and Pallu, from whom is the family of the Palluites;
verses.textLa: Ruben primogenitus Israel. Huius filius, Henoch, a quo familia Henochitarum: et Phallu, a quo familia Phalluitarum:

verses.textEn: and Hezron, from whom is the family of the Hezronites; and Carmi, from whom is the family of the Carmites.
verses.textLa: et Hesron, a quo familia Hesronitarum: et Charmi, a quo familia Charmitarum.

verses.textEn: These are the families of the stock of Ruben, whose number was found to be forty-three thousand and seven hundred thirty.
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt familiæ de stirpe Ruben: quarum numerus inventus est quadraginta tria millia, et septingenti triginta.

verses.textEn: The son of Phallu: Eliab;
verses.textLa: Filius Phallu, Eliab.

verses.textEn: his sons, Nemuel and Dathan and Abiram. These are Dathan and Abiram, the leaders of the people, who rose up against Moses and Aaron in the sedition at Korah, when they rebelled against the Lord.
verses.textLa: Huius filii, Namuel et Dathan et Abiron. Isti sunt Dathan et Abiron principes populi, qui surrexerunt contra Moysen et Aaron in seditione Core, quando adversus Dominum rebellaverunt:

verses.textEn: And the earth, opening its mouth, devoured Korah, with many others dying, when the fire burned two hundred fifty men. And a great miracle was wrought,
verses.textLa: et aperiens terra os suum devoravit Core, morientibus plurimis, quando combussit ignis ducentos quinquaginta viros. Et factum est grande miraculum,

verses.textEn: so that, when Korah perished, his sons did not perish.
verses.textLa: ut, Core pereunte, filii illius non perirent.

verses.textEn: The sons of Simeon, by their kinships: Nemuel, from him is the family of the Nemuelites; Jamin, from him is the family of the Jaminites; Jachin, from him is the family of the Jachinites;
verses.textLa: Filii Simeon per cognationes suas: Namuel, ab hoc familia Namuelitarum: Iamin, ab hoc familia Iaminitarum: Iachin, ab hoc familia Iachinitarum:

verses.textEn: Sohar, from him is the family of the Soharites; Shaul, from him is the family of the Shaulites.
verses.textLa: Zare, ab hoc familia Zareitarum: Saul, ab hoc familia Saulitarum.

verses.textEn: These are the families of the stock of Simeon, whose entire number was twenty-two thousand two hundred.
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt familiæ de stirpe Simeon, quarum omnis numerus fuit viginti duo millia ducenti.

verses.textEn: The sons of Gad, by their kinships: Zephon, from him is the family of the Zephonites; Haggi, from him is the family of the Haggites; Shuni, from him is the family of the Shunites;
verses.textLa: Filii Gad per cognationes suas: Sephon, ab hoc familia Sephonitarum: Aggi, ab hoc familia Aggitarum: Suni, ab hoc familia Sunitarum:

verses.textEn: Ozni, from him is the family of the Oznites; Eri, from him is the family of the Erites;
verses.textLa: Ozni, ab hoc familia Oznitarum: Her, ab hoc familia Heritarum:

verses.textEn: Arod, from him is the family of the Arodites; Areli, from him is the family of the Arelites.
verses.textLa: Arod, ab hoc familia Aroditarum: Ariel, ab hoc familia Arielitarum.

verses.textEn: These are the families of Gad, whose entire number was forty thousand five hundred.
verses.textLa: Istæ sunt familiæ Gad, quarum omnis numerus fuit quadraginta millia quingenti.

verses.textEn: The sons of Judah: Er and Onan, who both died in the land of Canaan.
verses.textLa: Filii Iuda, Her et Onan, qui ambo mortui sunt in Terra Chanaan.

verses.textEn: And these were the sons of Judah, by their kinships: Shelah, from whom is the family of the Shelahites; Perez, from whom is the family of the Perezites; Zerah, from whom is the family of the Zerahites.
verses.textLa: Fueruntque filii Iuda, per cognationes suas: Sela, a quo familia Selaitarum: Phares, a quo familia Pharesitarum: Zare, a quo familia Zareitarum.

verses.textEn: Moreover, the sons of Phares were: Hezron, from whom is the family of the Hezronites; and Hamul, from whom is the family of the Hamulites.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Phares: Hesron, a quo familia Hesronitarum: et Hamul, a quo familia Hamulitarum.

verses.textEn: These are the families of Judah, whose entire number was seventy-six thousand five hundred.
verses.textLa: Istæ sunt familiæ Iuda, quarum omnis numerus fuit septuaginta sex millia quingenti.

verses.textEn: The sons of Issachar, by their kinships: Tola from whom is the family of the Tolaites; Puvah, from whom is the family of the Puvahites;
verses.textLa: Filii Issachar, per cognationes suas: Thola, a quo familia Tholaitarum: Phua, a quo familia Phuaitarum:

verses.textEn: Jashub, from whom is the family of the Jashubites; Shimron, from whom is the family of the Shimronites.
verses.textLa: Iasub, a quo familia Iasubitarum: Semran, a quo familia Semranitarum.

verses.textEn: These are the kinships of Issachar, whose number was sixty-four thousand three hundred.
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt cognationes Issachar, quarum numerus fuit sexaginta quattuor millia trecenti.

verses.textEn: The sons of Zebulon by their kinships: Sered, from whom is the family of the Seredites; Elon, from whom is the family of the Elonites; Jahleel, from whom is the family of the Jahleelites.
verses.textLa: Filii Zabulon per cognationes suas: Sared, a quo familia Sareditarum: Elon, a quo familia Elonitarum: Ialel, a quo familia Ialelitarum.

verses.textEn: These are the kinships of Zebulun, whose number was sixty thousand five hundred.
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt cognationes Zabulon, quarum numerus fuit sexaginta millia quingenti.

verses.textEn: The sons of Joseph by their kinships: Manasseh and Ephraim.
verses.textLa: Filii Ioseph per cognationes suas, Manasse et Ephraim.

verses.textEn: From Manasseh was born Machir, from whom is the family of the Machirites. Machir conceived Gilead, from whom is the family of the Gileadites.
verses.textLa: De Manasse ortus est Machir, a quo familia Machiritarum. Machir genuit Galaad, a quo familia Galaaditarum.

verses.textEn: Gilead had sons: Jezer, from whom is the family of the Jezerites; and Helek, from whom is the family of the Helekites;
verses.textLa: Galaad habuit filios: Iezer, a quo familia Iezeritarum: et Helec, a quo familia Helecitarum:

verses.textEn: and Asriel, from whom is the family of the Asrielites; and Shechem, from whom is the family of the Shechemites;
verses.textLa: et Asriel, a quo familia Asrielitarum: et Sechem, a quo familia Sechemitarum:

verses.textEn: and Shemida, from whom is the family of the Shemidaites; and Hepher, from whom is the family of the Hepherites.
verses.textLa: et Semida, a quo familia Semidaitarum: et Hepher, a quo familia Hepheritarum.

verses.textEn: Now Hepher was the father of Zelophehad, who had no sons, but only daughters, whose names are these: Mahlah, and Noa, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.textLa: Fuit autem Hepher pater Salphaad, qui filios non habebat, sed tantum filias, quarum ista sunt nomina: Maala, et Noa, et Hegla, et Melcha, et Thersa.

verses.textEn: These are the families of Manasseh, and their number was fifty-two thousand seven hundred.
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt familiæ Manasse, et numerus earum, quinquaginta duo millia septingenti.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Ephraim by their kinships were these: Shuthelah, from whom is the family of the Shuthelahites; Becher, from whom is the family of the Becherites; Tahan, from whom is the family of the Tahanites.
verses.textLa: Filii autem Ephraim per cognationes suas fuerunt hi: Suthala, a quo familia Suthalaitarum: Becher, a quo familia Becheritarum: Thehen, a quo familia Thehenitarum.

verses.textEn: Furthermore, the son of Shuthelah was Eran, from whom is the family of the Eranites.
verses.textLa: Porro filius Suthala fuit Heran, a quo familia Heranitarum.

verses.textEn: These are the kinships of the sons of Ephraim, whose number was thirty-two thousand five hundred.
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt cognationes filiorum Ephraim, quarum numerus fuit triginta duo millia quingenti.

verses.textEn: These are the sons of Joseph by their families: the sons of Benjamin in their kinships: Bela, from whom is the family of the Belaites; Ashbel, from whom is the family of the Ashbelites; Ahiram, from whom is the family of the Ahiramites;
verses.textLa: Isti sunt filii Ioseph per familias suas. Filii Beniamin in cognationibus suis: Bela, a quo familia Belaitarum: Asbel, a quo familia Asbelitarum: Ahiram, a quo familia Ahiramitarum:

verses.textEn: Shupham, from whom is the family of the Shuphamites; Hupham, from whom is the family of the Huphamites.
verses.textLa: Supham, a quo familia Suphamitarum: Hupham, a quo familia Huphamitarum.

verses.textEn: The sons of Bela: Arad and Naaman. From Arad, the family of the Aradites; from Naaman, the family of the Naamanites.
verses.textLa: Filii Bela: Hered, et Noeman. De Hered, familia Hereditarum: de Noeman, familia Noemanitarum.

verses.textEn: These are the sons of Benjamin by their kinships, whose number was forty-five thousand six hundred.
verses.textLa: Hi sunt filii Beniamin per cognationes suas, quorum numerus fuit quadraginta quinque millia sexcenti.

verses.textEn: The sons of Dan by their kinships: Shuham, from whom is the family of the Shuhamites. These are the kinships of Dan by their families.
verses.textLa: Filii Dan per cognationes suas: Suham, a quo familia Suhamitarum. Hæ sunt cognationes Dan per familias suas.

verses.textEn: All these were Shuhamites, whose number was sixty-four thousand four hundred.
verses.textLa: Omnes fuere Suhamitæ, quorum numerus erat sexaginta quattuor millia quadringenti.

verses.textEn: The sons of Asher by their kinships: Imnah, from whom is the family of the Imnahites; Ishvi, from whom is the family of the Ishvites; Beriah, from whom is the family of the Beriahites.
verses.textLa: Filii Aser per cognationes suas: Iemna, a quo familia Iemnaitarum: Iessui, a quo familia Iessuitarum: Brie, a quo familia Brieitarum.

verses.textEn: The sons of Beriah: Heber, from whom is the family of the Heberites; and Malchiel, from whom is the family of the Malchielites.
verses.textLa: Filii Brie: Heber, a quo familia Heberitarum: et Melchiel, a quo familia Melchielitarum.

verses.textEn: Now the name of the daughter of Asher was Serah.
verses.textLa: Nomen autem filiæ Aser, fuit Sara.

verses.textEn: These are the kinships of the sons of Asher, and their number was fifty-three thousand four hundred.
verses.textLa: Hæ cognationes filiorum Aser, et numerus eorum quinquaginta tria millia quadringenti.

verses.textEn: The sons of Naphtali by their kinships: Jahzeel, from whom is the family of the Jahzeelites; Guni, from whom is the family of the Gunites;
verses.textLa: Filii Nephthali per cognationes suas: Iesiel, a quo familia Iesielitarum: Guni, a quo familia Gunitarum:

verses.textEn: Jezer, from whom is the family of the Jezerites; Shillem, from whom is the family of the Shillemites.
verses.textLa: Ieser, a quo familia Ieseritarum: Sellem, a quo familia Sellemitarum.

verses.textEn: These are the kinships of the sons of Naphtali by their families, whose number was forty-five thousand four hundred.
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt cognationes filiorum Nephthali per familias suas: quorum numerus quadraginta quinque millia quadringenti.

verses.textEn: This is the sum of the sons of Israel, who were counted: six hundred thousand and one thousand seven hundred thirty.
verses.textLa: Ista est summa filiorum Israel, qui recensiti sunt, sexcenta millia, et mille septingenti triginta.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “The land shall be divided to these, as their possessions, according to the number of their names.
verses.textLa: Istis dividetur terra iuxta numerum vocabulorum in possessiones suas.

verses.textEn: To the greater number you shall give a greater portion, and to the lesser number, a lesser portion. To each one, just as they have now been counted, a possession shall be delivered.
verses.textLa: Pluribus maiorem partem dabis, et paucioribus minorem: singulis, sicut nunc recensiti sunt, tradetur possessio:

verses.textEn: Yet only in so far as the land is divided by lot to a tribe and to families.
verses.textLa: ita dumtaxat ut sors Terram tribubus dividat et familiis.

verses.textEn: Whatever the lot will happen to be, it shall be accepted, either by the greater, or by the lesser.
verses.textLa: Quidquid sorte contigerit, hoc vel plures accipiant, vel pauciores.

verses.textEn: Likewise, this is the number of the sons of Levi by their families: Gershon, from whom is the family of the Gershonites; Kohath, from whom is the family of the Kohathites; Merari, from whom is the family of the Merarites.
verses.textLa: Hic quoque est numerus filiorum Levi per familias suas: Gerson, a quo familia Gersonitarum: Caath, a quo famiia Caathitarum: Merari, a quo familia Meraritarum.

verses.textEn: These are the families of Levi: The family of Libni, the family of Hebroni, the family of Mahli, the family of Mushi, the family of Korah. Yet truly, Kohath conceived Amram,
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt familiæ Levi: Familia Lobni, familia Hebroni, familia Moholi, familia Musi, familia Core. At vero Caath genuit Amram:

verses.textEn: who had a wife, Jochebed, the daughter of Levi, who was born to him in Egypt. She bore, to her husband Amram: sons, Aaron and Moses, as well as their sister, Miriam.
verses.textLa: qui habuit uxorem Iochabed filiam Levi, quæ nata est ei in Ægypto. Hæc genuit Amram viro suo filios, Aaron et Moysen, et Mariam sororem eorum:

verses.textEn: From Aaron were born Nadab and Abihu, and Eleazar and Ithamar.
verses.textLa: De Aaron orti sunt Nadab et Abiu, et Eleazar et Ithamar:

verses.textEn: Of these, Nadab and Abihu died, when they had offered strange fire before the Lord.
verses.textLa: quorum Nadab et Abiu mortui sunt, cum obtulissent ignem alienum coram Domino.

verses.textEn: And these were all who were numbered: twenty-three thousand of the male gender, from one month and above. For they were not counted among the sons of Israel, neither was a possession given to them with the others.
verses.textLa: Fueruntque omnes, qui numerati sunt, viginti tria millia generis masculini ab uno mense et supra: quia non sunt recensiti inter filios Israel, nec eis cum ceteris data possessio est.

verses.textEn: This is the number of the sons of Israel, who were enrolled by Moses and by Eleazar the priest, in the plains of Moab, above the Jordan, opposite Jericho.
verses.textLa: Hic est numerus filiorum Israel, qui descripti sunt a Moyse et Eleazaro sacerdote, in campestribus Moab supra Iordanem contra Iericho.

verses.textEn: Among these, not one of them was numbered before, by Moses and Aaron in the desert of Sinai.
verses.textLa: Inter quos nullus fuit eorum, qui ante numerati sunt a Moyse et Aaron in deserto Sinai:

verses.textEn: For the Lord had foretold that all would die in the wilderness. And not one of them remained, except Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.
verses.textLa: Prædixerat enim Dominus quod omnes morerentur in solitudine. Nullusque remansit ex eis, nisi Caleb filius Iephone, et Iosue filius Nun.

verses.textEn: Then there approached the daughters of Zelophehad, the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, who was the son of Joseph: and their names are Mahlah, and Noa, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Tirzah.
verses.textLa: Accesserunt autem filiæ Salphaad, filii Hepher, filii Galaad, filii Machir, filii Manasse, qui fuit filius Ioseph: quarum sunt nomina, Maala, et Noa, et Hegla, et Melcha, et Thersa.
verses.notes: The permission given for inheritance, and therefore lineage also, to descend through a female family member, rather than only a male, is a foreshadowing of the lineage of Christ through Mary. For Joseph was not Christ’s biological father, and so the lineage of the body of Christ was through Mary only. Joachim had no sons, only daughters (the Virgin Mary and her older sister), so lineage through Mary is in harmony with Jewish religious observance.

verses.textEn: And they stood before Moses and Eleazar the priest, and all the leaders of the people, at the door of the tabernacle of the covenant, and they said:
verses.textLa: Steteruntque coram Moyse et Eleazaro sacerdote, et cunctis principibus populi ad ostium tabernaculi fœderis, atque dixerunt:

verses.textEn: “Our father died in the desert, and was not with the sedition, which was stirred up against the Lord under Korah, but he died in his own sin; he had no male sons. Why is his name taken away from his family, because he had no son? Give us a possession among the kinsmen of our father.”
verses.textLa: Pater noster mortuus est in deserto, nec fuit in seditione, quæ concitata est contra Dominum sub Core, sed in peccato suo mortuus est: hic non habuit mares filios. Cur tollitur nomen illius de familia sua, quia non habuit filium? Date nobis possessionem inter cognatos patris nostri.

verses.textEn: And Moses referred their case to the judgment of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Retulitque Moyses causam earum ad iudicium Domini.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to him:
verses.textLa: Qui dixit ad eum:

verses.textEn: “The daughters of Zelophehad are asking for something just. So give them a possession among the kinsmen of their father, and let them succeed him in his inheritance.
verses.textLa: Iustam rem postulant filiæ Salphaad: da eis possessionem inter cognatos patris sui, et ei in hereditatem succedant.

verses.textEn: And to the sons of Israel, you shall speak these things:
verses.textLa: Ad filios autem Israel loqueris hæc:

verses.textEn: When a man dies without a son, his inheritance shall be transferred to his daughter.
verses.textLa: Homo cum mortuus fuerit absque filio, ad filiam eius transibit hereditas.

verses.textEn: If he has no daughter, his brothers shall succeed him.
verses.textLa: Si filiam non habuerit, habebit successores fratres suos.

verses.textEn: But if there were also no brothers, you shall give the inheritance to the brothers of his father.
verses.textLa: Quod si et fratres non fuerint, dabitis hereditatem fratribus patris eius.

verses.textEn: But if he has no paternal uncles, the inheritance shall be given to those who are closest to him. And this shall be, for the sons of Israel, consecrated as a perpetual law, just as the Lord has instructed Moses.”
verses.textLa: Sin autem nec patruos habuerit, dabitur hereditas his, qui ei proximi sunt. Eritque hoc filiis Israel sanctum lege perpetua, sicut præcepit Dominus Moysi.

verses.textEn: The Lord also said to Moses: “Ascend onto this mountain, Abarim, and contemplate from there the land, which I will give to the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Dixit quoque Dominus ad Moysen: Ascende in montem istum Abarim, et contemplare inde Terram, quam daturus sum filiis Israel.

verses.textEn: And when you have seen it, you shall then go to your people, just as your brother Aaron went.
verses.textLa: Cumque videris eam, ibis et tu ad populum tuum, sicut ivit frater tuus Aaron:

verses.textEn: For you offended me in the desert of Sin at the Contradiction of the multitude; neither were you willing to sanctify me in their sight over the waters. These are the Waters of Contradiction at Kadesh in the desert of Sin.”
verses.textLa: quia offendistis me in deserto Sin in contradictione multitudinis, nec sanctificare me voluistis coram ea super aquas. Hæ sunt aquæ contradictionis in Cades deserti Sin.

verses.textEn: Moses answered him:
verses.textLa: Cui respondit Moyses:

verses.textEn: “May the Lord, the God of the spirits of all flesh, provide a man, who may be over this multitude,
verses.textLa: Provideat Dominus Deus spirituum omnis carnis, hominem, qui sit super multitudinem hanc:

verses.textEn: and who may be able to exit and enter before them, and who may lead them out or lead them in: lest the people of the Lord be like sheep without a shepherd.”
verses.textLa: et possit exire et intrare ante eos, et educere eos vel introducere: ne sit populus Domini sicut oves absque pastore.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to him: “Take Joshua, the son of Nun, a man in whom the Spirit is, and place your hand upon him.
verses.textLa: Dixitque Dominus ad eum: Tolle Iosue filium Nun virum in quo est Spiritus, et pone manum tuam super eum.

verses.textEn: And he shall stand before Eleazar the priest and the entire multitude.
verses.textLa: Qui stabit coram Eleazaro sacerdote et omni multitudine:

verses.textEn: And you shall give him the precepts in the sight of all, and a portion of your glory, so that the entire congregation of the sons of Israel may listen to him.
verses.textLa: et dabis ei præcepta cunctis videntibus, et partem gloriæ tuæ, ut audiat eum omnis synagoga filiorum Israel.

verses.textEn: On his behalf, if anything is to be done, Eleazar the priest shall consult the Lord. He, and all the sons of Israel with him, and the rest of the multitude, shall go out and enter in at his word.”
verses.textLa: Pro hoc, si quid agendum erit, Eleazar sacerdos consulet Dominum. Ad verbum eius egredietur et ingredietur ipse, et omnes filii Israel cum eo, et cetera multitudo.

verses.textEn: Moses did just as the Lord had instructed. And when he had brought Joshua, he set him before Eleazar the priest, and before the entire gathering of the people.
verses.textLa: Fecit Moyses ut præceperat Dominus. Cumque tulisset Iosue, statuit eum coram Eleazaro sacerdote et omni frequentia populi.

verses.textEn: And imposing his hands upon his head, he repeated all that the Lord had commanded.
verses.textLa: Et impositis capiti eius manibus, cuncta replicavit quæ mandaverat Dominus.

verses.textEn: The Lord also said to Moses:
verses.textLa: Dixit quoque Dominus ad Moysen:

verses.textEn: “Instruct the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: Offer my oblation and bread, and the incense of most sweet odor, at their proper times.
verses.textLa: Præcipe filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Oblationem meam et panes, et incensum odoris suavissimi offerte per tempora sua.

verses.textEn: These are the sacrifices which you must offer: Two immaculate one-year-old lambs each day as a perpetual holocaust.
verses.textLa: Hæc sunt sacrificia quæ offerre debetis: Agnos anniculos immaculatos duos quotidie in holocaustum sempiternum:

verses.textEn: You shall offer one in morning, and the other in the evening,
verses.textLa: unum offeretis mane, et alterum ad vesperum:

verses.textEn: and the tenth part of an ephah of fine wheat flour, which has been sprinkled with the purest oil, and which has the measure of the fourth part of a hin.
verses.textLa: decimam partem ephi similæ, quæ conspersa sit oleo purissimo, et habeat quartam partem hin.

verses.textEn: It is the continual holocaust which you offered at mount Sinai as a most sweet odor of incense to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Holocaustum iuge est quod obtulistis in monte Sinai in odorem suavissimum incensi Domini.

verses.textEn: And you shall offer a libation of wine, of the fourth part of a hin for each lamb, in the Sanctuary of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Et libabitis vini quartam partem hin per agnos singulos in Sanctuario Domini.

verses.textEn: And you shall offer the other lamb similarly, in the evening, according to all the rites of the morning sacrifice and its libations, as an oblation of most sweet odor to the Lord.
verses.textLa: Alterumque agnum similiter offeretis ad vesperam iuxta omnem ritum sacrificii matutini, et libamentorum eius, oblationem suavissimi odoris Domino.

verses.textEn: Then, on the Sabbath day, you shall offer two immaculate one-year-old lambs, and two tenths of fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil, as sacrifice, as well as the libations
verses.textLa: Die autem sabbati offeretis duos agnos anniculos immaculatos, et duas decimas similæ oleo conspersæ in sacrificio, et liba

verses.textEn: that are usually poured out on each Sabbath as a perpetual holocaust.
verses.textLa: quæ rite funduntur per singula sabbata in holocaustum sempiternum.

verses.textEn: Then, on the first day of the month, you shall offer a holocaust to the Lord: two calves from the herd, one ram, seven immaculate one-year-old lambs,
verses.textLa: In calendis autem offeretis holocaustum Domino, vitulos de armento duos, arietem unum, agnos anniculos septem immaculatos,

verses.textEn: and three tenths of fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil, as sacrifice, for each calf, and two tenths of fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil, for each ram,
verses.textLa: et tres decimas similæ oleo conspersæ in sacrificio per singulos vitulos: et duas decimas similæ oleo conspersæ per singulos arietes:

verses.textEn: and one tenth of fine wheat flour with oil, as a sacrifice, for each lamb. It is a holocaust of most sweet odor and also an incense to the Lord.
verses.textLa: et decimam decimæ similæ ex oleo in sacrificio per agnos singulos. Holocaustum suavissimi odoris atque incensi est Domino.
verses.notes: The expression ‘decimam decimæ’ does not literally mean ‘a tenth of a tenth’ (i.e. a hundredth); rather, it refers to one tenth part. Of the tenths into which the ephah is divided, one tenth of those tenths is ‘decimam decimæ’.

verses.textEn: Now these shall be the libations of wine, which are to be poured out for each victim: one half portion of a hin for each calf, one third for a ram, and one fourth for a lamb. This shall be the holocaust for all the months, as they succeed one another in the turning of the year.
verses.textLa: Libamenta autem vini, quæ per singulas fundenda sunt victimas, ista erunt: media pars hin per singulos vitulos, tertia per arietem, quarta per agnum. Hoc erit holocaustum per omnes menses, qui sibi anno vertente succedunt.

verses.textEn: Likewise, a he-goat shall be offered to the Lord for sin, with the perpetual holocaust and its libations.
verses.textLa: Hircus quoque offeretur Domino pro peccatis in holocaustum sempiternum cum libamentis suis.

verses.textEn: Then, in the first month, the fourteenth day of the month shall be the Passover of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Mense autem primo, quartadecima die mensis Phase Domini erit,

verses.textEn: And the fifteenth day shall be a solemnity. For seven days, they shall eat unleavened bread.
verses.textLa: et quintadecima die solemnitas: septem diebus vescentur azymis.

verses.textEn: And the first day of these days shall be venerable and holy; you shall not do any servile work in it.
verses.textLa: Quarum dies prima venerabilis et sancta erit: omne opus servile non facietis in ea.

verses.textEn: And you shall offer the incense of a holocaust to the Lord, two calves from the herd, one ram, seven immaculate one-year-old lambs;
verses.textLa: Offeretisque incensum holocaustum Domino, vitulos de armento duos, arietem unum, agnos anniculos immaculatos septem:

verses.textEn: and with each sacrifice, from fine wheat flour which has been sprinkled with oil, three tenths for each calf, and two tenths for each ram,
verses.textLa: et sacrificia singulorum ex simila quæ conspersa sit oleo, tres decimas per singulos vitulos, et duas decimas per arietem,

verses.textEn: and one tenth for each lamb, that is, for the seven lambs;
verses.textLa: et decimam decimæ per agnos singulos, id est, per septem agnos.

verses.textEn: and one he-goat for sin, as an expiation for you,
verses.textLa: Et hircum pro peccato unum, ut expietur pro vobis,

verses.textEn: aside from the morning holocaust, which you shall always offer.
verses.textLa: præter holocaustum matutinum quod semper offeretis.

verses.textEn: You shall do this on each day of the seven days, as fuel for the fire, and as a most sweet odor to the Lord, which shall rise up from the holocaust and from each of the libations.
verses.textLa: Ita facietis per singulos dies septem dierum in fomitem ignis, et in odorem suavissimum Domino, qui surget de holocausto, et de libationibus singulorum.

verses.textEn: Likewise, the seventh day shall be very honored and holy for you. Any servile work, you shall not do in it.
verses.textLa: Dies quoque septimus celeberrimus et sanctus erit vobis: omne opus servile non facietis in eo.

verses.textEn: And also the day of the first-fruits, after the weeks have been fulfilled, when you shall offer new fruits to the Lord, shall be venerable and holy. You shall not do any servile work in it.
verses.textLa: Dies etiam primitivorum quando offeretis novas fruges Domino, expletis hebdomadibus, venerabilis et sancta erit: omne opus servile non facietis in ea.

verses.textEn: And you shall offer a holocaust as a most sweet odor to the Lord: two calves from the herd, one ram, and seven immaculate one-year-old lambs,
verses.textLa: Offeretisque holocaustum in odorem suavissimum Domino, vitulos de armento duos, arietem unum, et agnos anniculos immaculatos septem:

verses.textEn: and also, as their sacrifices, fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil, three tenths for each calf, two for each ram,
verses.textLa: atque in sacrificiis eorum similæ oleo conspersæ tres decimas per singulos vitulos, per arietes duas,

verses.textEn: one tenth for each lamb, which all together are seven lambs; likewise, a he-goat,
verses.textLa: per agnos decimam decimæ, qui simul sunt agni septem: hircum quoque

verses.textEn: which is slain for expiation, aside from the perpetual holocaust and its libations.
verses.textLa: qui mactatur pro expiatione: præter holocaustum sempiternum et liba eius.

verses.textEn: You shall offer only what is immaculate, with their libations.”
verses.textLa: Immaculata offeretis omnia cum libationibus suis.

verses.textEn: “Now the first day of the seventh month also shall be venerable and holy to you. In it, you shall not do any servile work, because it is the day of the sounding of the trumpets.
verses.textLa: Mensis etiam septimi prima dies venerabilis et sancta erit vobis. Omne opus servile non facietis in ea, quia dies clangoris est et tubarum.

verses.textEn: And you shall offer a holocaust, as a most sweet odor to the Lord: one calf from the herd, one ram, and seven immaculate one-year-old lambs;
verses.textLa: Offeretisque holocaustum in odorem suavissimum Domino, vitulum de armento unum, arietem unum, et agnos anniculos immaculatos septem:

verses.textEn: and, as their sacrifices, fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil: three tenths for each calf, two tenths for a ram,
verses.textLa: et in sacrificiis eorum similæ oleo conspersæ tres decimas per singulos vitulos, duas decimas per arietem,

verses.textEn: one tenth for a lamb, which all together are seven lambs;
verses.textLa: unam decimam per agnum, qui simul sunt agni septem:

verses.textEn: and a he-goat for sin, which is offered as an expiation for the people,
verses.textLa: et hircum pro peccato, qui offertur in expiationem populi,

verses.textEn: aside from the holocaust of the first day of the month with its sacrifices, and the perpetual holocaust with the usual libations. By these same ceremonies, you shall offer incense as a most sweet odor to the Lord.
verses.textLa: præter holocaustum calendarum cum sacrificiis suis, et holocaustum sempiternum cum libationibus solitis. Eisdem ceremoniis offeretis in odorem suavissimum incensum Domino.

verses.textEn: Likewise, the tenth day of this seventh month shall be for you holy and venerable, and you shall afflict your souls. You shall do no servile work in it.
verses.textLa: Decima quoque dies mensis huius septimi erit vobis sancta atque venerabilis, et affligetis animas vestras: omne opus servile non facietis in ea.

verses.textEn: And you shall offer a holocaust to the Lord, as a most sweet odor: one calf from the herd, one ram, seven immaculate one-year-old lambs;
verses.textLa: Offeretisque holocaustum Domino in odorem suavissimum, vitulum de armento unum, arietem unum, agnos anniculos immaculatos septem:

verses.textEn: and for their sacrifices, fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil: three tenths for each calf, two tenths for a ram,
verses.textLa: et in sacrificiis eorum similæ oleo conspersæ tres decimas per singulos vitulos, duas decimas per arietem,

verses.textEn: one tenth for each lamb, which are all together seven lambs;
verses.textLa: decimam decimæ per agnos singulos, qui sunt simul agni septem:

verses.textEn: and a he-goat for sin, apart from those things which are usually offered for offenses as an expiation, and as a perpetual holocaust, with their sacrifice and libations.
verses.textLa: et hircum pro peccato, absque his quæ offerri pro delicto solent in expiationem, et holocaustum sempiternum, cum sacrificio et libaminibus eorum.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, which shall be for you holy and venerable, you shall not do any servile work in it, but you shall celebrate a solemnity to the Lord for seven days.
verses.textLa: Quintadecima vero die mensis septimi, quæ vobis sancta erit atque venerabilis, omne opus servile non facietis in ea, sed celebrabitis sollemnitatem Domino septem diebus.

verses.textEn: And you shall offer a holocaust, as a most sweet odor to the Lord: thirteen calves from the herd, two rams, fourteen immaculate one-year-old lambs;
verses.textLa: Offeretisque holocaustum in odorem suavissimum Domino, vitulos de armento tredecim, arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quattuordecim:

verses.textEn: and as their libations, fine wheat flour sprinkled with oil: three tenths for each calf, which is all together thirteen calves, and two tenths for each ram, that is, all together two rams,
verses.textLa: et in libamentis eorum similæ oleo conspersæ tres decimas per vitulos singulos, qui sunt simul vituli tredecim: et duas decimas arieti uno, id est, simul arietibus duobus,

verses.textEn: and one tenth for each lamb, which is all together fourteen lambs;
verses.textLa: et decimam decimæ agnis singulis, qui sunt simul agni quattuordecim:

verses.textEn: and a he-goat for sin, apart from the perpetual holocaust, and the sacrifice and its libation.
verses.textLa: et hircum pro peccato, absque holocausto sempiterno, et sacrificio, et libamine eius.

verses.textEn: On the next day, you shall offer twelve calves from the herd, two rams, and fourteen immaculate one-year-old lambs.
verses.textLa: In die altero offeretis vitulos de armento duodecim, arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quattuordecim:

verses.textEn: And the sacrifices and libations for each of the calves and the rams and the lambs, you shall celebrate according to the rite,
verses.textLa: sacrificiaque et libamina singulorum per vitulos et arietes et agnos rite celebrabitis:

verses.textEn: with a he-goat for sin, apart from the perpetual holocaust, and the sacrifice and its libation.
verses.textLa: et hircum pro peccato, absque holocausto sempiterno, sacrificioque et libamine eius.

verses.textEn: On the third day, you shall offer eleven calves, two rams, and fourteen immaculate one-year-old lambs.
verses.textLa: Die tertio offeretis vitulos undecim, arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quattuordecim:

verses.textEn: And the sacrifices and libations for each of the calves and the rams and the lambs, you shall celebrate according to the rite,
verses.textLa: sacrificiaque et libamina singulorum per vitulos et arietes et agnos rite celebrabitis:

verses.textEn: with a he-goat for sin, apart from the perpetual holocaust, and the sacrifice and its libation.
verses.textLa: et hircum pro peccato, absque holocausto sempiterno, sacrificioque et libamine eius.

verses.textEn: On the fourth day, you shall offer ten calves, two rams, and fourteen immaculate one-year-old lambs.
verses.textLa: Die quarto offeretis vitulos decem, arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quattuordecim:

verses.textEn: And the sacrifices and the libations for each of the calves and the rams and the lambs, you shall celebrate according to the rite,
verses.textLa: sacrificiaque et libamina singulorum per vitulos et arietes et agnos rite celebrabitis:

verses.textEn: with a he-goat for sin, apart from the perpetual holocaust, and its sacrifice and libation.
verses.textLa: et hircum pro peccato, absque holocausto sempiterno, sacrificioque eius et libamine.

verses.textEn: On the fifth day, you shall offer nine calves, two rams, and fourteen immaculate one-year-old lambs.
verses.textLa: Die quinto offeretis vitulos novem, arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quattuordecim:

verses.textEn: And the sacrifices and libations for each of the calves and the rams and the lambs, you shall celebrate according to the rite,
verses.textLa: sacrificiaque et libamina singulorum per vitulos et arietes et agnos rite celebrabitis:

verses.textEn: with a he-goat for sin, apart from the perpetual holocaust, and its sacrifice and libation.
verses.textLa: et hircum pro peccato, absque holocausto sempiterno, sacrificioque eius et libamine.

verses.textEn: On the sixth day, you shall offer eight calves, two rams, and fourteen immaculate one-year-old lambs.
verses.textLa: Die sexto offeretis vitulos octo, arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quattuordecim:

verses.textEn: And the sacrifices and libations for each of the calves and the rams and the lambs, you shall celebrate according to the rite,
verses.textLa: sacrificiaque et libamina singulorum per vitulos et arietes et agnos rite celebrabitis:

verses.textEn: with a he-goat for sin, apart from the perpetual holocaust, and its sacrifice and libation.
verses.textLa: et hircum pro peccato, absque holocausto sempiterno, sacrificioque eius et libamine.

verses.textEn: On the seventh day, you shall offer seven calves, and two rams, and fourteen immaculate one-year-old lambs.
verses.textLa: Die septimo offeretis vitulos septem, et arietes duos, agnos anniculos immaculatos quattuordecim:

verses.textEn: And the sacrifices and libations for each of the calves and the rams and the lambs, you shall celebrate according to the rite,
verses.textLa: sacrificiaque et libamina singulorum per vitulos et arietes et agnos rite celebrabitis:

verses.textEn: with a he-goat for sin, apart from the perpetual holocaust, and its sacrifice and libation.
verses.textLa: et hircum pro peccato, absque holocausto sempiterno, sacrificioque eius et libamine.

verses.textEn: On the eighth day, which is most honored, you shall not do any servile work,
verses.textLa: Die octavo, qui est celeberrimus, omne opus servile non facietis,

verses.textEn: offering a holocaust as a most sweet odor to the Lord: one calf, one ram, and seven immaculate one-year-old lambs.
verses.textLa: offerentes holocaustum in odorem suavissimum Domino, vitulum unum, arietem unum, agnos anniculos immaculatos septem:

verses.textEn: And the sacrifices and libations for each of the calves and the rams and the lambs, you shall celebrate according to the rite,
verses.textLa: sacrificiaque et libamina singulorum per vitulos et arietes et agnos rite celebrabitis:

verses.textEn: with a he-goat for sin, apart from the perpetual holocaust, and its sacrifice and libation.
verses.textLa: et hircum pro peccato, absque holocausto sempiterno, sacrificioque eius et libamine.

verses.textEn: These things you shall offer to the Lord in your solemnities, aside from the vowed and voluntary oblations, as a holocaust, as a sacrifice, as a libation, or as peace-offering victims.”
verses.textLa: Hæc offeretis Domino in sollemnitatibus vestris: præter vota et oblationes spontaneas in holocausto, in sacrificio, in libamine, et in hostiis pacificis.

verses.textEn: And Moses explained to the sons of Israel all that the Lord had commanded him.
verses.textLa: Narravitque Moyses filiis Israel omnia quæ ei Dominus imperarat:

verses.textEn: And he said to the leaders of the tribes of the sons of Israel: “This is the word, which the Lord has instructed:
verses.textLa: et locutus est ad principes tribuum filiorum Israel: Iste est sermo quem præcepit Dominus:

verses.textEn: If any man makes a vow to the Lord, or binds himself by an oath, he shall not make his word null and void, but all that he has promised, he shall fulfill.
verses.textLa: Si quis virorum votum Domino voverit, aut se constrinxerit iuramento: non faciet irritum verbum suum, sed omne quod promisit, implebit.

verses.textEn: If a woman, who is in her father’s house, vows anything, or binds herself by an oath, and she is still in a state of childhood, if her father knew of the vow which she has promised or of the oath by which she has obligated her soul, and he kept silent, she shall be liable to the vow:
verses.textLa: Mulier si quippiam voverit, et se constrinxerit iuramento, quæ est in domo patris sui, et in ætate adhuc puellari: si cognoverit pater votum quod pollicita est, et iuramentum quo obligavit animam suam, et tacuerit, voti rea erit:

verses.textEn: whatever she has promised or swore, she shall complete in deed.
verses.textLa: quidquid pollicita est et iuravit, opere complebit.

verses.textEn: But if her father, as soon as he had heard it, had contradicted it, both her vows and her oaths shall be nullified, neither shall she be held liable to the promise, because her father had contradicted it.
verses.textLa: Sin autem statim ut audierit, contradixerit pater: et vota et iuramenta eius irrita erunt, nec obnoxia tenebitur sponsioni, eo quod contradixerit pater.

verses.textEn: If she has a husband, and she has vowed anything, then, once the word has gone out of her mouth, she will have obligated her soul by an oath.
verses.textLa: Si maritum habuerit, et voverit aliquid, et semel de ore eius verbum egrediens animam eius obligaverit iuramento:

verses.textEn: On the day that her husband will hear of it, and yet not contradict it, she shall be liable to the vow, and she shall repay whatever she has promised.
verses.textLa: quo die audierit vir, et non contradixerit, voti rea erit, reddetque quodcumque promiserat.

verses.textEn: But if, as soon as he hears it, he contradicts it, then he will have caused her promises, and the words by which she had bound her soul, to be null and void. The Lord will be favorable to her.
verses.textLa: Sin autem audiens statim contradixerit, et irritas fecerit pollicitationes eius, verbaque quibus obstrinxerat animam suam: propitius erit ei Dominus.
verses.notes: The translation should not say that the Lord will ‘forgive’ her, for she has done nothing wrong in obeying her husband and the Law, which has duly nullified her vow or promise. The Lord will favor her because she was obedient to husband and to the Law.

verses.textEn: Widows and divorced women shall repay whatever they have vowed.
verses.textLa: Vidua et repudiata quidquid voverint, reddent.

verses.textEn: If a wife in the house of her husband has bound herself by a vow or an oath,
verses.textLa: Uxor in domo viri cum se voto constrinxerit et iuramento,

verses.textEn: if her husband heard it and remained silent, and he did not contradict the promise, she shall repay what she had promised.
verses.textLa: si audierit vir, et tacuerit, nec contradixerit sponsioni, reddet quodcumque promiserat.

verses.textEn: But if he promptly contradicts it, she shall not be held liable to the promise. For her husband has contradicted it. And the Lord will be favorable to her.
verses.textLa: Sin autem extemplo contradixerit, non tenebitur promissionis rea: quia maritus contradixit: et Dominus ei propitius erit.

verses.textEn: If she has vowed or bound herself by oath, in order to afflict her soul by fasting, or by abstaining from other things, it shall be for the arbitration of her husband, as to whether or not she may do it.
verses.textLa: Si voverit, et iuramento se constrinxerit, ut per ieiunium, vel ceterarum rerum abstinentiam affligat animam suam, in arbitrio viri erit ut faciat, sive non faciat.

verses.textEn: But if the husband, upon hearing it, remains silent, and he delays judgment until another day, whatever she had vowed or promised, she shall repay, because when he first heard it, he remained silent.
verses.textLa: Quod si audiens vir tacuerit, et in alteram diem distulerit sententiam: quidquid voverat atque promiserat, reddet: quia statim ut audivit, tacuit.

verses.textEn: And if he contradicted it only sometime after he had known about it, he shall bear his iniquity.”
verses.textLa: Sin autem contradixerit postquam rescivit, portabit ipse iniquitatem eius.

verses.textEn: These are the laws which the Lord has appointed to Moses, between a husband and a wife, between a father and a daughter, who is still in the state of childhood or who remains in her father’s house.
verses.textLa: Istæ sunt leges, quas constituit Dominus Moysi inter virum et uxorem, inter patrem et filiam, quæ in puellari adhuc ætate est, vel quæ manet in parentis domo.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “First, avenge the sons of Israel from the Midianites, and then you shall be gathered to your people.”
verses.textLa: Ulciscere prius filios Israel de Madianitis, et sic colligeris ad populum tuum.

verses.textEn: And immediately Moses said: “Arm the men among you for a battle, so that they may be able to fulfill the retribution of the Lord on the Midianites.
verses.textLa: Statimque Moyses, Armate, inquit, ex vobis viros ad pugnam, qui possint ultionem Domini expetere de Madianitis.

verses.textEn: Let one thousand men be chosen from each tribe of Israel, who shall be sent to war.”
verses.textLa: Mille viri de singulis tribubus eligantur ex Israel qui mittantur ad bellum.

verses.textEn: And they gave one thousand from each tribe, that is, twelve thousand foot soldiers for battle.
verses.textLa: Dederuntque millenos de singulis tribubus, id est, duodecim millia expeditorum ad pugnam:

verses.textEn: And Moses sent them with Phinehas, the son of Eleazar the priest; also, he delivered to him the holy vessels, and the trumpets to sound.
verses.textLa: quos misit Moyses cum Phinees filio Eleazari sacerdotis, vasa quoque sancta, et tubas ad clangendum tradidit ei.

verses.textEn: And when they had fought against the Midianites and had prevailed, they killed all the men.
verses.textLa: Cumque pugnassent contra Madianitas atque vicissent, omnes mares occiderunt,

verses.textEn: And they put to death by the sword their kings: Evi, and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, the five leaders of the nation, and also Balaam the son of Beor.
verses.textLa: et reges eorum Evi, et Recem, et Sur, et Hur, et Rebe, quinque principes gentis: Balaam quoque filium Beor interfecerunt gladio.

verses.textEn: And they seized their women and little ones, and all their cattle, and all their goods; whatever they were able to have, they despoiled.
verses.textLa: Ceperuntque mulieres eorum, et parvulos, omniaque pecora, et cunctam supellectilem: quidquid habere potuerant depopulati sunt:

verses.textEn: Both their cities and their villages, as well as their fortresses, they burned.
verses.textLa: tam urbes quam viculos et castella flamma consumpsit.

verses.textEn: And they carried away prey from everything that they had seized, both of men and of beasts.
verses.textLa: Et tulerunt prædam, et universa quæ ceperant tam ex hominibus quam ex iumentis,

verses.textEn: And they led these to Moses and Eleazar the priest, and to all the multitude of the sons of Israel. But the remainder of the articles they carried to the camp on the plains of Moab, next to the Jordan, opposite Jericho.
verses.textLa: et adduxerunt ad Moysen, et Eleazarum sacerdotem, et ad omnem multitudinem filiorum Israel. Reliqua autem utensilia portaverunt ad castra in campestribus Moab iuxta Iordanem contra Iericho.

verses.textEn: Then Moses, and Eleazar the priest, and all the leaders of the assembly went out to meet them beyond the camp.
verses.textLa: Egressi sunt autem Moyses, et Eleazar sacerdos, et omnes principes synagogæ in occursum eorum extra castra.

verses.textEn: And Moses, being angry with the leaders of the army, and the tribunes, and the centurions, who had arrived from the battle,
verses.textLa: Iratusque Moyses principibus exercitus, tribunis, et centurionibus qui venerant de bello,

verses.textEn: said: “Why have you spared the females?
verses.textLa: ait: Cur feminas reservastis?

verses.textEn: Are not these the ones who deceived the sons of Israel at the suggestion of Balaam, and who caused you betray the Lord by the sin of Peor, because of which the people also were struck down?
verses.textLa: Nonne istæ sunt, quæ deceperunt filios Israel ad suggestionem Balaam, et prævaricari vos fecerunt in Domino super peccato Phogor, unde et percussus est populus?

verses.textEn: Therefore, put to death all of them: whatever is of the male sex, even among the little ones, and cut the throats of those women who have known men by sexual relations.
verses.textLa: Ergo cunctos interficite quidquid est generis masculinis, etiam in parvulis: et mulieres, quæ noverunt viros in coitu, iugulate:

verses.textEn: But the young girls, and all female virgins, reserve for yourselves.
verses.textLa: puellas autem et omnes feminas virgines reservate vobis:

verses.textEn: And remain beyond the camp for seven days. Whoever has killed a man, or who has touched one that was killed, shall be purified on the third day and on the seventh day.
verses.textLa: et manete extra castra septem diebus. Qui occiderit hominem, vel occisum tetigerit, lustrabitur die tertio et septimo.

verses.textEn: And all of the spoils, whether it is a garment, or a vessel, or another useful thing, made from the pelts or hair of goats, or from wood, shall be expiated.”
verses.textLa: Et de omni præda, sive vestimentum fuerit, sive vas, et aliquid in utensilia præparatum, de caprarum pellibus, et pilis, et ligno expiabitur.

verses.textEn: Likewise, Eleazar the priest spoke in this manner to the men of the army who had fought: “This is the precept of the law, which the Lord has commanded Moses:
verses.textLa: Eleazar quoque sacerdos ad viros exercitus, qui pugnaverunt, sic locutus est: Hoc est præceptum legis, quod mandavit Dominus Moysi:

verses.textEn: Gold, and silver, and brass, and iron, and lead, and tin,
verses.textLa: Aurum, et argentum, et æs, et ferrum, et plumbum, et stannum,

verses.textEn: and all that may be able to pass through fire, shall be purified by fire. But whatever is not able to sustain fire shall be sanctified with the waters of expiation.
verses.textLa: et omne, quod potest transire per flammas, igne purgabitur. Quidquid autem ignem non potest sustinere, aqua expiationis sanctificabitur:

verses.textEn: And you shall wash your garments on the seventh day, and, after having been purified, you shall enter the camp.”
verses.textLa: et lavabitis vestimenta vestra die septimo, et purificati postea castra intrabitis.

verses.textEn: And the Lord also said to Moses:
verses.textLa: Dixit quoque Dominus ad Moysen:

verses.textEn: “Take the sum of those things which were captured, from man even to beast, you and Eleazar the priest, and the leaders of the common people.
verses.textLa: Tollite summam eorum, quæ capta sunt ab homine usque ad pecus, tu et Eleazar sacerdos et principes vulgi:

verses.textEn: And you shall divide the prey equally, among those who went out to war and fought, and among the remainder of the multitude.
verses.textLa: dividesque ex æquo prædam inter eos, qui pugnaverunt egressique sunt ad bellum, et inter omnem reliquam multitudinem.

verses.textEn: And you shall separate a portion for the Lord from the portion of those who fought and were in the battle: one soul out of five hundred, as much from humans, as from oxen and donkeys and sheep.
verses.textLa: Et separabis partem Domino ab his, qui pugnaverunt et fuerunt in bello, unam animam de quingentis tam ex hominibus quam ex bobus et asinis et ovibus,
verses.notes: The word ‘hominibus’ is used to refer to men in the general sense of human persons, in this case only females.

verses.textEn: And you shall give it to Eleazar the priest, because these are the first-fruits of the Lord.
verses.textLa: et dabis eam Eleazaro sacerdoti, quia primitiæ Domini sunt.

verses.textEn: Likewise, from the half of the portion belonging to the sons of Israel, you shall receive the fiftieth head of humans, and of oxen, and donkeys, and sheep, and of all living things, and you shall give these to the Levites who stand watch over the care of the tabernacle of the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Ex media quoque parte filiorum Israel accipies quinquagesimum caput hominum, et boum, et asinorum, et ovium, cunctorum animantium, et dabis ea Levitis, qui excubant in custodiis tabernaculi Domini.

verses.textEn: And Moses and Eleazar did just as the Lord had instructed.
verses.textLa: Feceruntque Moyses, et Eleazar, sicut præceperat Dominus.

verses.textEn: Now the prey which the army had seized was six hundred seventy-five thousand sheep,
verses.textLa: Fuit autem præda, quam exercitus ceperat, ovium sexcenta septuaginta quinque millia,

verses.textEn: seventy-two thousand oxen,
verses.textLa: boum septuaginta duo millia,

verses.textEn: sixty-one thousand donkeys,
verses.textLa: asinorum sexaginta millia et mille:

verses.textEn: and thirty-two thousand human lives, of the female sex, who had not known men.
verses.textLa: animæ hominum sexus feminei, quæ non cognoverant viros, triginta duo millia.

verses.textEn: And one half of the portion was given to those who had been in the battle: three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep.
verses.textLa: Dataque est media pars his, qui in prælio fuerant, ovium trecenta triginta septem millia quingentæ:

verses.textEn: From these, for the portion of the Lord, there were accounted: six hundred seventy-five sheep;
verses.textLa: e quibus in partem Domini supputatæ sunt oves sexcentæ septuaginta quinque.

verses.textEn: and from the thirty-six thousand oxen, seventy-two oxen;
verses.textLa: Et de bobus triginta sex millibus, boves septuaginta et duo:

verses.textEn: from the thirty thousand five hundred donkeys, sixty-one donkeys.
verses.textLa: de asinis triginta millibus quingentis, asini sexaginta unus:

verses.textEn: From the sixteen thousand human souls, there fell to the portion of the Lord thirty-two souls.
verses.textLa: de animabus hominum sedecim millibus, cesserunt in partem Domini triginta duæ animæ.

verses.textEn: And Moses delivered the number of the first-fruits of the Lord to Eleazar the priest, just as had been commanded of him,
verses.textLa: Tradiditque Moyses numerum primitiarum Domini Eleazaro sacerdoti, sicut fuerat ei imperatum,

verses.textEn: from the one half portion belonging to the sons of Israel, which he had separated from the portion of those who had been in the battle.
verses.textLa: ex media parte filiorum Israel, quam separaverat his, qui in prælio fuerant.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, from the one half portion which fell to the remainder of the multitude, that is, from the three hundred thirty-seven thousand five hundred sheep,
verses.textLa: De media vero parte, quæ contigerat reliquæ multitudini, id est, de ovibus trecentis triginta septem millibus quingentis,

verses.textEn: and from the thirty-six thousand oxen,
verses.textLa: et de bobus triginta sex millibus,

verses.textEn: and from the thirty thousand five hundred donkeys,
verses.textLa: et de asinis triginta millibus quingentis,

verses.textEn: and from the sixteen thousand persons,
verses.textLa: et de hominibus sedecim millibus,

verses.textEn: Moses took the fiftieth head, and gave it to the Levites who stand watch at the tabernacle of the Lord, just as the Lord had instructed.
verses.textLa: tulit Moyses quinquagesimum caput, et dedit Levitis, qui excubabant in tabernaculo Domini, sicut præceperat Dominus.

verses.textEn: And when the leaders of the army, and the tribunes, and the centurions had approached Moses, they said:
verses.textLa: Cumque accessissent principes exercitus ad Moysen, et tribuni, centurionesque dixerunt:

verses.textEn: “We, your servants, have taken a census of the number of the fighting men, whom we had under our hand, and indeed not one was lacking.
verses.textLa: Nos servi tui recensuimus numerum pugnatorum, quos habuimus sub manu nostra: et ne unus quidem defuit.

verses.textEn: For this reason, we offer as gifts to the Lord whatever gold each one was able to find amid the spoils, in anklets and arm bands, rings and bracelets, and little chains, so that you may intercede for us to the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Ob hanc causam offerimus in donariis Domini singuli quod in præda auri potuimus invenire, periscelides et armillas, annulos et dextralia, ac murænulas, ut depreceris pro nobis Dominum.

verses.textEn: And Moses and Eleazar the priest received all the gold in its various kinds,
verses.textLa: Susceperuntque Moyses, et Eleazar sacerdos omne aurum in diversis speciebus,

verses.textEn: weighing sixteen thousand seven hundred fifty shekels, from the tribunes and the centurions.
verses.textLa: pondo sedecim millia, septingentos quinquaginta siclos a tribunis et centurionibus.

verses.textEn: For whatever each one had taken away in the spoils was his own.
verses.textLa: Unusquisque enim quod in præda rapuerat, suum erat.

verses.textEn: And having been accepted, they took it into the tabernacle of the testimony, as a memorial of the sons of Israel before the Lord.
verses.textLa: Et susceptum intulerunt in tabernaculum testimonii, in monimentum filiorum Israel coram Domino.

verses.textEn: Now the sons of Ruben and of Gad had many herds, and their substance in cattle was inestimable. And when they had seen that the lands of Jazer and Gilead were suitable for feeding animals,
verses.textLa: Filii autem Ruben et Gad habebant pecora multa, et erat illis in iumentis infinita substantia. Cumque vidissent Iazer, et Galaad aptas animalibus alendis terras,

verses.textEn: they went to Moses, and to Eleazar the priest and the leaders of the multitude, and they said:
verses.textLa: venerunt ad Moysen, et ad Elezarum sacerdotem, et principes multitudinis, atque dixerunt:

verses.textEn: “Ataroth, and Dibon, and Jazer, and Nimrah, Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Sebam, and Nebo, and Beon,
verses.textLa: Ataroth, et Dibon, et Iazer, et Nemra, Hesebon, et Eleale, et Saban, et Nebo, et Beon,

verses.textEn: the land, which the Lord has struck in the sight of the sons of Israel, is a very fertile region for pasturing animals. And we, your servants, have very many cattle.
verses.textLa: terra, quam percussit Dominus in conspectu filiorum Israel, regio uberrima est ad pastum animalium: et nos servi tui habemus iumenta plurima:

verses.textEn: And so we beseech you, if we have found favor before you, that you give it to us, your subjects, as a possession, and that you not cause us cross the Jordan.”
verses.textLa: precamurque si invenimus gratiam coram te, ut des nobis famulis tuis eam in possessionem, nec facias nos transire Iordanem.

verses.textEn: And Moses answered them: “Should your brothers go to battle, while you sit here?
verses.textLa: Quibus respondit Moyses: Numquid fratres vestri ibunt ad pugnam, et vos hic sedebitis?

verses.textEn: Why do you subvert the minds of the sons of Israel, so that they might not dare to cross into the place which the Lord will give to them?
verses.textLa: Cur subvertitis mentes filiorum Israel, ne transire audeant in locum, quem eis daturus est Dominus?

verses.textEn: Did not your fathers act in the same way, when I sent them from Kadesh-Barnea to explore the land?
verses.textLa: Nonne ita egerunt patres vestri, quando misi de Cadesbarne ad explorandam Terram?

verses.textEn: And when they had gone all the way to the Valley of the Cluster of Grapes, having viewed the entire region, they subverted the hearts of the sons of Israel, so that they would not enter into the parts that the Lord gave to them.
verses.textLa: Cumque venissent usque ad Vallem Botri, lustrata omni regione, subverterunt cor filiorum Israel, ut non intrarent fines, quos eis Dominus dedit.

verses.textEn: And being angry, the Lord swore an oath, saying:
verses.textLa: Qui iratus iuravit, dicens:

verses.textEn: ‘These men, who ascended out of Egypt, from twenty years and above, will not see the land, which I have promised under an oath to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. For they were not willing to follow me,
verses.textLa: Si videbunt homines isti, qui ascenderunt ex Ægypto a viginti annis et supra, Terram, quam sub iuramento pollicitus sum Abraham, Isaac, et Iacob: et noluerunt sequi me,
verses.notes: When translated literally, the verse only makes sense when one realizes that it is half an idea, with the first half of the idea being that the Lord has sworn. There is a popular expression: “I’ll be damned if... (such and such will ever happen).” This verse has a similar meaning in the Latin.

verses.textEn: except Caleb, the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, and Joshua the son of Nun; these have fulfilled my will.’
verses.textLa: præter Caleb filium Iephone Cenezæum, et Iosue filium Nun: isti impleverunt voluntatem meam.

verses.textEn: And the Lord, being angry against Israel, led them in a course through the desert for forty years, until the entire generation, which had done evil in his sight, was consumed.
verses.textLa: Iratusque Dominus adversum Israel, circumduxit eum per desertum quadraginta annis, donec consumeretur universa generatio, quæ fecerat malum in conspectu eius.

verses.textEn: And behold,” he said, “you have risen up in the place of your fathers, the offshoots and the nurslings of sinful men, in order to augment the fury of the Lord against Israel.
verses.textLa: Et ecce, inquit, vos surrexistis pro patribus vestris, incrementa, et alumni hominum peccatorum, ut augeretis furorem Domini contra Israel.

verses.textEn: But if you are not willing to follow him, he will leave the people behind in the wilderness, and you will have been the cause of all our deaths.”
verses.textLa: Quod si nolueritis sequi eum, in solitudine populum derelinquet, et vos causa eritis necis omnium.

verses.textEn: But approaching closer, they said: “We will manufacture sheep pens and cattle stalls, as well as fortified cities, for our little ones.
verses.textLa: At illi prope accedentes, dixerunt: Caulas ovium fabricabimus, et stabula iumentorum, parvulis quoque nostris urbes munitas:

verses.textEn: But we ourselves will continue on, armed and girded for battle, before the sons of Israel, until we lead them to their places. Our little ones, and whatever we may be able to have, shall be in walled cities, because of the treachery of the inhabitants.
verses.textLa: nos autem ipsi armati et accincti pergemus ad prælium ante filios Israel, donec introducamus eos ad loca sua. Parvuli nostri, et quidquid habere possumus, erunt in urbibus muratis, propter habitatorum insidias.

verses.textEn: We will not return to our houses, even until the sons of Israel may possess their inheritance.
verses.textLa: Non revertemur in domos nostras, usque dum possideant filii Israel hereditatem suam:

verses.textEn: Neither will we seek anything across the Jordan, because we already have our possession on its eastern side.”
verses.textLa: nec quidquam quæremus trans Iordanem, quia iam habemus nostram possessionem in orientali eius plaga.

verses.textEn: And Moses said to them: “If you accomplish what you have promised, you may go out, equipped for battle, before the Lord.
verses.textLa: Quibus Moyses ait: Si facitis quod promittitis, expediti pergite coram Domino ad pugnam:

verses.textEn: And let every fighting man cross over the Jordan, until the Lord overthrows his enemies,
verses.textLa: et omnis vir bellator armatus Iordanem transeat, donec subvertat Dominus inimicos suos,

verses.textEn: and all the land is subjected to him. Then you will be guiltless with the Lord and with Israel, and you will obtain the regions which you desire before the Lord.
verses.textLa: et subiiciatur ei omnis Terra: tunc eritis inculpabiles apud Dominum et apud Israel, et obtinebitis regiones, quas vultis coram Domino.

verses.textEn: But if you do not do what you have said, no one could doubt that you will have sinned against God. And know this: your sin shall overtake you.
verses.textLa: Sin autem quod dicitis, non feceritis, nulli dubium est quin peccetis in Deum: et scitote quoniam peccatum vestrum apprehendet vos.

verses.textEn: Therefore, build cities for your little ones, and pens and stables for your sheep and cattle; and fulfill what you have promised.”
verses.textLa: Ædificate ergo urbes parvulis vestris, et caulas, et stabula ovibus ac iumentis: et quod polliciti estis implete.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Gad and of Ruben said to Moses: “We are your servants, we shall do what you, our ruler, orders.
verses.textLa: Dixeruntque filii Gad et Ruben ad Moysen: Servi tui sumus, faciemus quod iubet dominus noster.

verses.textEn: We will leave behind our little ones, and our wives, and the sheep and cattle, in the cities of Gilead.
verses.textLa: Parvulos nostros, et mulieres, et pecora, ac iumenta relinquemus in urbibus Galaad:

verses.textEn: And we, your servants, all well-equipped, will go forth to battle, just as you, our ruler, has spoken.”
verses.textLa: nos autem famuli tui omnes expediti pergemus ad bellum, sicut tu domine loqueris.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Moses instructed Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the princes of the families throughout the tribes of Israel, and he said to them:
verses.textLa: Præcepit ergo Moyses Eleazaro sacerdoti, et Iosue filio Nun, et principibus familiarum per tribus Israel, et dixit ad eos:

verses.textEn: “If the sons of Gad and the sons of Ruben cross over the Jordan with you, all armed for war before the Lord, and if the land becomes subject to you, give them Gilead as a possession.
verses.textLa: Si transierint filii Gad, et filii Ruben vobiscum Iordanem omnes armati ad bellum coram Domino, et vobis fuerit Terra subiecta: date eis Galaad in possessionem.

verses.textEn: But if they are not willing to cross with you, armed, into the land of Canaan, then let them receive places among you for their dwellings.”
verses.textLa: Sin autem noluerint transire armati vobiscum in Terram Chanaan, inter vos habitandi accipiant loca.

verses.textEn: And the sons of Gad and the sons of Ruben responded: “Just as the Lord has spoken to his servants, so shall we do.
verses.textLa: Responderuntque filii Gad, et filii Ruben: Sicut locutus est Dominus servis suis, ita faciemus:

verses.textEn: We will go forth, armed, before the Lord into the land of Canaan; and we acknowledge that we have already received our possession across the Jordan.”
verses.textLa: ipsi armati pergemus coram Domino in Terram Chanaan, et possessionem iam suscepisse nos confitemur trans Iordanem.

verses.textEn: And so, Moses gave to the sons of Gad and of Ruben, and to half the tribe of Manasseh, the son of Joseph, the kingdom of Sihon, king of the Amorites, and the kingdom of Og, king of Bashan, and their land with its surrounding cities.
verses.textLa: Dedit itaque Moyses filiis Gad et Ruben, et dimidiæ tribui Manasse filii Ioseph regnum Sehon regis Amorrhæi, et regnum Og regis Basan, et terram eorum cum urbibus suis per circuitum.

verses.textEn: Therefore, the sons of Gad built up Dibon, and Ataroth, and Aroer,
verses.textLa: Igitur extruxerunt filii Gad, Dibon, et Ataroth, et Aroer,

verses.textEn: and Atroth and Shophan, and Jazer, and Jogbehah,
verses.textLa: et Etroth, et Sophan, et Iazer, et Iegbaa,

verses.textEn: and Beth-Nimrah, and Beth-Haran, as fortified cities with pens for their cattle.
verses.textLa: et Bethnemra, et Betharan, urbes munitas, et caulas pecoribus suis.

verses.textEn: Yet truly, the sons of Ruben built up Heshbon, and Elealeh, and Kiriathaim,
