verses.textLa: Filii vero Ruben ædificaverunt Hesebon, et Eleale, et Cariathaim,

verses.textEn: and Nebo, and Baal-meon (their names having been changed) and Sibmah, appointing names for the cities which they had built.
verses.textLa: et Nabo, et Baalmeon versis nominibus, Sabama quoque: imponentes vocabula urbibus, quas extruxerunt.

verses.textEn: Moreover, the sons of Machir, the son of Manasseh, continued on within Gilead, and they devastated it, putting to death its inhabitant, the Amorite.
verses.textLa: Porro filii Machir filii Manasse perrexerunt in Galaad, et vastaverunt eam interfecto Amorrhæo habitatore eius.

verses.textEn: Therefore, Moses gave the land of Gilead to Machir, the son of Manasseh, and he lived in it.
verses.textLa: Dedit ergo Moyses Terram Galaad Machir filio Manasse, qui habitavit in ea.

verses.textEn: But Jair, the son of Manasseh, went out and occupied its villages, which he called Havoth Jair, that is, the Villages of Jair.
verses.textLa: Iair autem filius Manasse abiit et occupavit vicos eius, quos appellavit Havoth Iair, id est, Villas Iair.

verses.textEn: Likewise, Nobah went forth and captured Kenath with its villages. And he called it by his own name, Nobah.
verses.textLa: Nobe quoque perrexit, et apprehendit Chanath cum viculis suis: vocavitque eam ex nomine suo Nobe.

verses.textEn: These are the lodging places of the sons of Israel, who departed from Egypt by their companies under the hand of Moses and Aaron,
verses.textLa: Hæ sunt mansiones filiorum Israel, qui egressi sunt de Ægypto per turmas suas in manu Moysi et Aaron,

verses.textEn: which Moses wrote down according to the places of the encampments, which they changed upon the order of the Lord.
verses.textLa: quas descripsit Moyses iuxta castrorum loca, quæ Domini iussione mutabant.

verses.textEn: Thus the sons of Israel set out from Rameses in the first month, on the fifteenth day of the first month, on the day after the Passover, with an exalted hand, being seen by all the Egyptians.
verses.textLa: Profecti igitur de Ramesse mense primo, quintadecima die mensis primi, altera die Phase filii Israel in manu excelsa videntibus cunctis Ægyptiis,

verses.textEn: And these were burying their firstborn, whom the Lord had struck down (for so, too, did he carry out retribution against their gods).
verses.textLa: et sepelientibus primogenitos, quos percusserat Dominus (nam et in diis eorum exercuerat ultionem)

verses.textEn: And they made camp at Soccoth.
verses.textLa: castrametati sunt in Soccoth.

verses.textEn: And from Soccoth they went to Etham, which is at the furthest limits of the wilderness.
verses.textLa: Et de Soccoth venerunt in Etham, quæ est in extremis finibus solitudinis.

verses.textEn: Departing from there, they arrived opposite Pi-hahiroth, which looks out toward Baal-zephon, and they were encamped before Migdol.
verses.textLa: Inde egressi venerunt contra Phihahiroth, quæ respicit Beelsephon, et castrametati sunt ante Magdalum.

verses.textEn: And setting out from Pi-hahiroth, they crossed through the middle of the Sea into the wilderness. And having walked for three days through the desert of Etham, they made camp at Marah.
verses.textLa: Profectique de Phihahiroth, transierunt per medium Mare in solitudinem: et ambulantes tribus diebus per desertum Etham, castrametati sunt in Mara.

verses.textEn: And setting out from Marah, they arrived at Elim, where there were twelve fountains of water and seventy palm trees. And they set up camp there.
verses.textLa: Profectique de Mara venerunt in Elim, ubi erant duodecim fontes aquarum, et palmæ septuaginta: ibique castrametati sunt.

verses.textEn: But departing from there also, they fixed their tents above the Red Sea. And setting out from the Red Sea,
verses.textLa: Sed et inde egressi, fixerunt tentoria super Mare Rubrum. Profectique de Mari Rubro,

verses.textEn: they were encamped in the desert of Sin.
verses.textLa: castrametati sunt in deserto Sin.

verses.textEn: Departing from there, they went to Dophkah.
verses.textLa: Unde egressi, venerunt in Daphca.

verses.textEn: And setting out from Dophkah, they made camp at Alush.
verses.textLa: Profectique de Daphca, castrametati sunt in Alus.

verses.textEn: And departing from Alush, they fixed their tents at Rephidim, where the people lacked water to drink.
verses.textLa: Egressique de Alus, fixere tentoria in Raphidim, ubi populo defuit aqua ad bibendum.

verses.textEn: And setting out from Rephidim, they camped in the desert of Sinai.
verses.textLa: Profectique de Raphidim, castrametati sunt in deserto Sinai.

verses.textEn: But departing also from the wilderness of the Sinai, they arrived at the Graves of Lust.
verses.textLa: Sed et de solitudine Sinai egressi, venerunt ad sepulchra concupiscentiæ.

verses.textEn: And setting out from the Graves of Lust, they were encamped at Hazeroth.
verses.textLa: Profectique de sepulchris concupiscentiæ, castrametati sunt in Haseroth.

verses.textEn: And from Hazeroth, they went to Rithmah.
verses.textLa: Et de Haseroth venerunt in Rethma.

verses.textEn: And setting out from Rithmah, they made camp at Rimmon-perez.
verses.textLa: Profectique de Rethma, castrametati sunt in Remmomphares.

verses.textEn: And departing from there, they arrived at Libnah.
verses.textLa: Unde egressi venerunt in Lebna.

verses.textEn: From Libnah, they made camp at Rissah.
verses.textLa: De Lebna castrametati sunt in Ressa.

verses.textEn: And departing from Rissah, they went to Kehelathah.
verses.textLa: Egressique de Ressa, venerunt in Ceelatha.

verses.textEn: Setting out from there, they were encamped at mount Shepher.
verses.textLa: Unde profecti castrametati sunt in monte Sepher.

verses.textEn: Departing from mount Shepher, they went to Haradah.
verses.textLa: Egressi de monte Sepher, venerunt in Arada.

verses.textEn: Continuing on from there, they made camp at Makheloth.
verses.textLa: Inde proficiscentes, castrametati sunt in Maceloth.

verses.textEn: And setting out from Makheloth, they went to Tahath.
verses.textLa: Profectique de Maceloth, venerunt in Thahath.

verses.textEn: From Tahath, they made camp at Terah.
verses.textLa: De Thahath castrametati sunt in Thare,

verses.textEn: Departing from there, they pitched their tents at Mithkah.
verses.textLa: Unde egressi, fixere tentoria in Methca.

verses.textEn: And from Mithkah, they were encamped at Hashmonah.
verses.textLa: Et de Methca castrametati sunt in Hesmona.

verses.textEn: And setting out from Hashmonah, they went to Moseroth.
verses.textLa: Profectique de Hesmona, venerunt in Moseroth.

verses.textEn: And from Moseroth, they made camp at Bene-jaakan.
verses.textLa: Et de Moseroth castrametati sunt in Beneiaacan.

verses.textEn: And setting out from Bene-jaakan, they went to mount Gidgad.
verses.textLa: Profectique de Beneiaacan, venerunt in montem Gadgad.

verses.textEn: Setting out from there, they were encamped at Jotbathah.
verses.textLa: Unde profecti, castrametati sunt in Ietebatha.

verses.textEn: And from Jotbathah, they went to Abronah.
verses.textLa: Et de Ietebatha venerunt in Hebrona.

verses.textEn: And departing from Abronah, they made camp at Eziongeber.
verses.textLa: Egressique de Hebrona, castrametati sunt in Asiongaber.

verses.textEn: Setting out from there, they went into the desert of Sin, which is Kadesh.
verses.textLa: Inde profecti, venerunt in desertum Sin, hæc est Cades.

verses.textEn: And departing from Kadesh, they encamped at mount Hor, at the furthermost limits of the land of Edom.
verses.textLa: Egressique de Cades, castrametati sunt in monte Hor, in extremis finibus Terræ Edom.

verses.textEn: And Aaron the priest ascended onto mount Hor, by the order of the Lord. And there he died, in the fortieth year of the departure of the sons of Israel from Egypt, in the fifth month, on the first day of the month,
verses.textLa: Ascenditque Aaron sacerdos in montem Hor iubente Domino: et ibi mortuus est anno quadragesimo egressionis filiorum Israel ex Ægypto, mense quinto, prima die mensis,

verses.textEn: when he was one hundred twenty-three years old.
verses.textLa: cum esset annorum centum viginti trium.

verses.textEn: And king Arad the Canaanite, who lived toward the south, heard that the sons of Israel had arrived in the land of Canaan.
verses.textLa: Audivitque Chananæus rex Arad, qui habitabat ad meridiem, in Terram Chanaan venisse filios Israel.

verses.textEn: And setting out from mount Hor, they made camp at Zalmonah.
verses.textLa: Et profecti de monte Hor, castrametati sunt in Salmona.

verses.textEn: Departing from there, they went to Punon.
verses.textLa: Unde egressi, venerunt in Phunon.

verses.textEn: And setting out from Punon, they were encamped at Oboth.
verses.textLa: Profectique de Phunon, castrametati sunt in Oboth.

verses.textEn: And from Oboth, they went to Iye-abarim, which is at the borders of the Moabites.
verses.textLa: Et de Oboth, venerunt in Iieabarim, quæ est in finibus Moabitarum.

verses.textEn: And setting out from Iye-abarim, they fixed their tents at Dibon-gad.
verses.textLa: Profectique de Iieabarim, fixere tentoria in Dibongad.

verses.textEn: Departing from there, they made camp at Almon-diblathaim.
verses.textLa: Unde egressi, castrametati sunt in Helmondeblathaim.

verses.textEn: And departing from Almon-diblathaim, they went to the mountains of Abarim, opposite Nebo.
verses.textLa: Egressique de Helmondeblathaim, venerunt ad montes Abarim contra Nabo.

verses.textEn: And setting out from the mountains of Abarim, they crossed over to the plains of Moab, above the Jordan, opposite Jericho.
verses.textLa: Profectique de montibus Abarim, transierunt ad campestria Moab, supra Iordanem contra Iericho.

verses.textEn: And they made camp there, from Beth-jeshimoth all the way to Abel-shittim, in the level places of the Moabites,
verses.textLa: Ibique castrametati sunt de Bethsimoth usque ad Abelsatim in planioribus locis Moabitarum,

verses.textEn: where the Lord said to Moses:
verses.textLa: ubi locutus est Dominus ad Moysen:

verses.textEn: “Instruct the sons of Israel, and say to them: When you will have crossed over the Jordan, entering into the land of Canaan,
verses.textLa: Præcipe filiis Israel, et dic ad eos: Quando transieritis Iordanem, intrantes Terram Chanaan,

verses.textEn: destroy all the inhabitants of that land. Break their monuments, and shatter their statues, and lay waste to every exalted thing,
verses.textLa: disperdite cunctos habitatores Terræ illius: confringite titulos, et statuas comminuite, atque omnia excelsa vastate,

verses.textEn: cleansing the land and living in it. For I have given it you as a possession,
verses.textLa: mundantes terram, et habitantes in ea. Ego enim dedi vobis illam in possessionem,

verses.textEn: which you shall divide among you by lot. To the greater number you shall give more, and to the lesser number, less. To each one, just as the lot shall fall, so shall the inheritance be distributed. The possession shall be divided by the tribes and families.
verses.textLa: quam dividetis vobis sorte. Pluribus dabitis latiorem, et paucis angustiorem. Singulis ut sors ceciderit, ita tribuetur hereditas. Per tribus et familias possessio dividetur.

verses.textEn: But if you are not willing to put to death the inhabitants of the land, those who remain shall be to you like spikes in your eyes and lances in your sides, and they shall be adversaries to you in the land of your habitation.
verses.textLa: Sin autem nolueritis interficere habitatores Terræ: qui remanserint, erunt vobis quasi clavi in oculis, et lanceæ in lateribus, et adversabuntur vobis in Terra habitationis vestræ:

verses.textEn: And whatever I had decided to do to them, I will do to you.”
verses.textLa: et quidquid illis cogitaveram facere, vobis faciam.

verses.textEn: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.textLa: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:

verses.textEn: “Instruct the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: When you will have entered into the land of Canaan, and it has fallen into your possession by lot, it shall be bound by these limits:
verses.textLa: Præcipe filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Cum ingressi fueritis Terram Chanaan, et in possessionem vobis sorte ceciderit, his finibus terminabitur.

verses.textEn: The southern part shall begin from the wilderness of Sin, which is next to Edom, and it shall have the Sea of Salt as a limit to the east.
verses.textLa: Pars meridiana incipiet a solitudine Sin, quæ est iuxta Edom: et habebit terminos contra Orientem mare salsissimum.

verses.textEn: It shall circle on the south side along the ascent of the Scorpion, by this way crossing into Senna, and passing through, from the south, as far as Kadesh-barnea, from which its confines shall go out to the town called Adar, and extend even to Azmon.
verses.textLa: Qui circuibunt australem plagam per ascensum Scorpionis, ita ut transeant in Senna, et perveniant a meridie usque ad Cadesbarne, unde egredientur confinia ad villam nomine Adar, et tendent usque ad Asemona.

verses.textEn: And its limits shall go around from Azmon to the Torrent of Egypt, and shall end at the shore of the Great Sea.
verses.textLa: Ibitque per gyrum terminus ab Asemona usque ad Torrentem Ægypti, et maris magni littore finietur.

verses.textEn: Then the western region shall begin from the Great Sea, and the same shall be its end.
verses.textLa: Plaga autem occidentalis a mari magno incipiet, et ipso fine claudetur.

verses.textEn: Furthermore, toward the northern region, its limits shall begin from the Great Sea, passing through even to the highest mountain.
verses.textLa: Porro ad septentrionalem plagam a mari magno termini incipient, pervenientes usque ad montem altissimum,

verses.textEn: From there, it limits shall advance into Hamath, as far as the limits of Zedad.
verses.textLa: a quo venient in Emath usque ad terminos Sedada:

verses.textEn: And its confines shall go all the way to Ziphron, and to the village of Enan. These shall be the limits on the northern side.
verses.textLa: ibuntque confinia usque ad Zephrona, et villam Enan. Hi erunt termini in parte Aquilonis.

verses.textEn: From there, its limits shall be measured, facing the east side, from the village of Enan as far as Shepham.
verses.textLa: Inde metabuntur fines contra orientalem plagam de villa Enan usque Sephama,

verses.textEn: And from Shepham, the boundaries shall descend into Riblah, opposite the fountain of Daphnis. From there, the boundaries shall pass through, opposite the east, to the Sea of Chinnereth,
verses.textLa: et de Sephama descendent termini in Rebla contra fontem Daphnim: inde pervenient contra Orientem ad mare Cenereth,

verses.textEn: and shall extend as far as the Jordan, and, at the furthest extent, shall be enclosed by the Sea of Salt. You shall have this land, with its borders all around.”
verses.textLa: et tendent usque ad Iordanem, et ad ultimum salsissimo claudentur mari. Hanc habebitis Terram per fines suos in circuitu.
verses.notes: There is a certain eschatological meaning to this passage, especially to the 12 tribes which split into 9.5 tribes and 2.5 tribes, and also to the limits of the Holy Land.

verses.textEn: And Moses instructed the sons of Israel, saying: “This shall be the land which you shall possess by lot, and which the Lord has ordered to be given to the nine tribes, and to the half tribe.
verses.textLa: Præcepitque Moyses filiis Israel, dicens: Hæc erit Terra, quam possidebitis sorte, et quam iussit Dominus dari novem tribubus, et dimidiæ tribui.

verses.textEn: For the tribe of the sons of Ruben, by their families, and the tribe of the sons of Gad, according to the number of their kinships, and also one half of the tribe of Manasseh,
verses.textLa: Tribus enim filiorum Ruben per familias suas, et tribus filiorum Gad iuxta cognationum numerum, media quoque tribus Manasse,

verses.textEn: that is, two and a half tribes, have received their portion across the Jordan, opposite Jericho, toward the eastern side.”
verses.textLa: id est, duæ semis tribus, acceperunt partem suam trans Iordanem contra Iericho ad orientalem plagam.

verses.textEn: And the Lord said to Moses:
verses.textLa: Et ait Dominus ad Moysen:

verses.textEn: “These are the names of the men, who shall divide the land for you: Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun,
verses.textLa: Hæc sunt nomina virorum, qui Terram vobis divident, Eleazar sacerdos, et Iosue filius Nun,

verses.textEn: and one leader from each tribe,
verses.textLa: et singuli principes de tribubus singulis,

verses.textEn: whose names are these: from the tribe of Judah, Caleb the son of Jephunneh;
verses.textLa: quorum ista sunt vocabula: De tribu Iuda, Caleb filius Iephone.

verses.textEn: from the tribe of Simeon, Samuel the son of Ammihud;
verses.textLa: De tribu Simeon, Samuel filius Ammiud.

verses.textEn: from the tribe of Benjamin, Elidad the son of Chislon;
verses.textLa: De tribu Beniamin, Elidad filius Chaselon.

verses.textEn: from the tribe of the sons of Dan, Bukki the son of Jogli;
verses.textLa: De tribu filiorum Dan, Bocci filius Iogli.

verses.textEn: of the sons of Joseph, from the tribe of Manasseh, Hanniel the son of Ephod;
verses.textLa: Filiorum Ioseph de tribu Manasse, Hanniel filius Ephod.

verses.textEn: from the tribe of Ephraim, Kemuel the son of Shiphtan;
verses.textLa: De tribu Ephraim, Camuel filius Sephthan.

verses.textEn: from the tribe of Zebulon, Elizaphan the son of Parnach;
verses.textLa: De tribu Zabulon, Elisaphan filius Pharnach.

verses.textEn: from the tribe of Issachar, Paltiel the leader, the son of Azzan;
verses.textLa: De tribu Issachar, dux Phaltiel filius Ozan.
verses.notes: The word ‘dux,’ meaning leader or commander, often has a military as well as a political connotation; thus Paltiel was probably a leader in his tribe, as well as a leader in battle.

verses.textEn: from the tribe of Asher, Ahihud the son of Shelomi;
verses.textLa: De tribu Aser, Ahiud filius Salomi.

verses.textEn: from the tribe of Naphtali, Pedahel the son of Ammihud.”
verses.textLa: De tribu Nephthali, Phedael filius Ammiud.

verses.textEn: These are the ones that the Lord has ordered to divide the land of Canaan to the sons of Israel.
verses.textLa: Hi sunt, quibus præcepit Dominus ut dividerent filiis Israel Terram Chanaan.

verses.textEn: And the Lord also spoke these things to Moses in the plains of Moab, above the Jordan, opposite Jericho:
verses.textLa: Hæc quoque locutus est Dominus ad Moysen in campestribus Moab supra Iordanem, contra Iericho:

verses.textEn: “Instruct the sons of Israel, so that they may give to the Levites, from their possessions,
verses.textLa: Præcipe filiis Israel ut dent Levitis de possessionibus suis

verses.textEn: cities as dwelling places, with their surrounding suburbs, so that they may lodge in the towns, and so that the suburbs may be for cattle and beasts of burden.
verses.textLa: urbes ad habitandum, et suburbana earum per circuitum: ut ipsi in oppidis maneant, et suburbana sint pecoribus ac iumentis:

verses.textEn: The suburbs shall extend from the outer walls of the cities, all around, for the space of one thousand steps.
verses.textLa: quæ a muris civitatum forinsecus, per circuitum, mille passuum spatio tendentur.

verses.textEn: Facing the east, there shall be two thousand cubits, and facing the south, similarly, there shall be two thousand cubits. Toward the sea, also, which looks out toward the west, there shall be the same measure, and the northern region shall be bounded by equal limits. And the cities shall be in the center, and the suburbs shall be outside.
verses.textLa: Contra Orientem duo millia erunt cubiti, et contra Meridiem similiter erunt duo millia: ad mare quoque, quod respicit ad Occidentem, eadem mensura erit, et septentrionalis plaga æquali termino finietur. Eruntque urbes in medio, et foris suburbana.

verses.textEn: Now, from the towns which you shall give to the Levites, six shall be separated for the assistance of fugitives, so that he who has shed blood may flee to them. And, aside from these, there shall be forty-two other towns,
verses.textLa: De ipsis autem oppidis, quæ Levitis dabitis, sex erunt in fugitivorum auxilia separata, ut fugiat ad ea qui fuderit sanguinem: et exceptis his, alia quadraginta duo oppida,

verses.textEn: that is, all together forty-eight with their suburbs.
verses.textLa: id est, simul quadraginta octo cum suburbanis suis.

verses.textEn: And concerning these cities, which shall be given from the possessions of the sons of Israel: from those who have more, more shall be taken, and from those who have less, less shall be taken. Each shall give towns to the Levites according to the measure of their inheritance.”
verses.textLa: Ipsæque urbes, quæ dabuntur de possessionibus filiorum Israel, ab his, qui plus habent, plures auferentur: et qui minus, pauciores. Singuli iuxta mensuram hereditatis suæ dabunt oppida Levitis.

verses.textEn: The Lord said to Moses:
verses.textLa: Ait Dominus ad Moysen:

verses.textEn: “Speak to the sons of Israel, and you shall say to them: When you will have crossed the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
verses.textLa: Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos: Quando transgressi fueritis Iordanem in Terram Chanaan,

verses.textEn: discern which cities ought to be for the protection of fugitives who have shed blood unwillingly.
verses.textLa: decernite quæ urbes esse debeant in præsidia fugitivorum, qui nolentes sanguinem fuderint:

verses.textEn: And when a fugitive is in these, the kinsman of the deceased shall not be able to kill him, until he stands in the sight of the multitude and his case is judged.
verses.textLa: in quibus cum fuerit profugus, cognatus occisi non poterit eum occidere, donec stet in conspectu multitudinis, et causa illius iudicetur.

verses.textEn: Then, among those cities which are separated for relief to fugitives,
verses.textLa: De ipsis autem urbibus, quæ ad fugitivorum subsidia separantur,

verses.textEn: three shall be across the Jordan, and three in the land of Canaan,
verses.textLa: tres erunt trans Iordanem, et tres in Terra Chanaan,

verses.textEn: as much for the sons of Israel as for newcomers and sojourners, so that anyone who has shed blood unwillingly may flee to these places.
verses.textLa: tam filiis Israel quam advenis atque peregrinis, ut confugiat ad eas qui nolens sanguinem fuderit.

verses.textEn: If anyone will have struck someone with iron, and he who was struck will have died, then he shall be guilty of homicide, and he himself shall die.
verses.textLa: Si quis ferro percusserit, et mortuus fuerit qui percussus est: reus erit homicidii, et ipse morietur.

verses.textEn: If he will have thrown a stone, and he who has been struck lies dead, then he shall be punished similarly.
verses.textLa: Si lapidem iecerit, et ictus occubuerit: similiter punietur.

verses.textEn: If he who has been struck with wood passes away, he shall be avenged by the blood of the one who struck him.
verses.textLa: Si ligno percussus interierit: percussoris sanguine vindicabitur.

verses.textEn: The close relative of the deceased shall put to death the murderer; as soon as he apprehends him, he shall put him to death.
verses.textLa: Propinquus occisi, homicidam interficiet, statim ut apprehenderit eum, interficiet.

verses.textEn: If, out of hatred, anyone assaults a man, or throws anything at him with ill intent,
verses.textLa: Si per odium quis hominem impulerit, vel iecerit quippiam in eum per insidias:

verses.textEn: or, while being his enemy, strikes him with his hand, and so he has died, the attacker shall be guilty of murder. The kinsman of the deceased, as soon as he finds him, shall cut his throat.
verses.textLa: aut cum esset inimicus, manu percusserit, et ille mortuus fuerit: percussor, homicidii reus erit. Cognatus occisi statim ut invenerit eum, iugulabit.
verses.notes: The word ‘jugulabit’ is a harsh word referring to death by having one’s throat cut. It is related to the English word ‘jugular.’

verses.textEn: But if by chance, and without hatred
verses.textLa: Quod si fortuitu, et absque odio,

verses.textEn: or animosity, he will have done any of these things,
verses.textLa: et inimicitiis quidquam horum fecerit,

verses.textEn: and this has been proven in the hearing of the people, and the questions have been aired, between the one who struck and the close relative,
verses.textLa: et hoc audiente populo fuerit comprobatum, atque inter percussorem et propinquum sanguinis quæstio ventilata:

verses.textEn: then the innocent one shall be freed from the hand of the revenger, and he shall be returned by this judgment into the city to which he had fled, and he shall stay there until the high priest, who has been anointed with the holy oil, dies.
verses.textLa: liberabitur innocens de ultoris manu, et reducetur per sententiam in urbem, ad quam confugerat, manebitque ibi, donec sacerdos magnus, qui oleo sancto unctus est, moriatur.

verses.textEn: If the one who has killed has been found beyond the limits of the cities which have been assigned to the exiled,
verses.textLa: Si interfector extra fines urbium, quæ exulibus deputatæ sunt,

verses.textEn: and he has been struck by him who is avenging blood, he who killed him shall not be harmed.
verses.textLa: fuerit inventus, et percussus ab eo qui ultor est sanguinis: absque noxa erit qui eum occiderit.

verses.textEn: For the fugitive ought to have resided in the city, until the death of the high priest. Then, after he is dead, the one who has killed shall be returned to his own land.
verses.textLa: Debuerat enim profugus usque ad mortem Pontificis in urbe residere: postquam autem ille obierit, homicida revertetur in terram suam.

verses.textEn: These things shall be a perpetual ordinance in all your habitations.
verses.textLa: Hæc sempiterna erunt, et legitima in cunctis habitationibus vestris.

verses.textEn: The punishment of a murderer shall be based upon testimony; but no one shall be condemned upon the testimony of only one person.
verses.textLa: Homicida sub testibus punietur: ad unius testimonium nullus condemnabitur.

verses.textEn: You shall not accept money from him who is guilty of blood, and he shall be put to death promptly.
verses.textLa: Non accipietis pretium ab eo, qui reus est sanguinis, statim et ipse morietur.

verses.textEn: Exiles and fugitives, prior to the death of the high priest, are by no means able to be returned to their own cities.
verses.textLa: Exules et profugi ante mortem Pontificis nullo modo in urbes suas reverti poterunt:

verses.textEn: Do not pollute the land of your habitation, so as to stain it with the blood of the innocent; neither is it able to be expiated in any way other than by the blood of him who has shed the blood of another.
verses.textLa: ne polluatis terram habitationis vestræ, quæ insontium cruore maculatur: nec aliter expiari potest, nisi per eius sanguinem, qui alterius sanguinem fuderit.

verses.textEn: And so shall your possession be cleansed, while I myself am abiding with you. For I am the Lord, who lives among the sons of Israel.”
verses.textLa: Atque ita emundabitur vestra possessio, me commorante vobiscum. Ego enim sum Dominus qui habito inter filios Israel.

verses.textEn: Then the leaders of the families of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, from the stock of the sons of Joseph, approached and spoke to Moses before the leaders of Israel, and they said:
verses.textLa: Accesserunt autem et principes familiarum Galaad filii Machir, filii Manasse de stirpe filiorum Ioseph: locutique sunt Moysi coram principibus Israel, atque dixerunt:

verses.textEn: “The Lord has instructed you, our ruler, so that you would divide the land by lot to the sons of Israel, and so that you would give to the daughters of Zelophehad, our brother, the possession owed to their father.
verses.textLa: Tibi domino nostro præcepit Dominus ut Terram sorte divideres filiis Israel, et ut filiabus Salphaad fratris nostri dares possessionem debitam patri:

verses.textEn: But if men of another tribe receive them as wives, their possession will follow them, and having been transferred to another tribe, there will be a reduction in our inheritance.
verses.textLa: quas si alterius tribus homines uxores acceperint, sequetur possessio sua, et translata ad aliam tribum de nostra hereditate minuetur.

verses.textEn: And so it may be that, when the Jubilee of remission, that is, the fiftieth year, has arrived, the distribution by lots shall be confounded, and the possession of the one shall be transferred to others.”
verses.textLa: Atque ita fiet, ut cum Iubilæus, id est, quinquagesimus annus remissionis advenerit, confundatur sortium distributio, et aliorum possessio ad alios transeat.

verses.textEn: Moses answered the sons of Israel, and, at the instruction of the Lord, he said: “The tribe of the sons of Joseph has spoken correctly.
verses.textLa: Respondit Moyses filiis Israel, et Domino præcipiente, ait: Recte tribus filiorum Ioseph locuta est.

verses.textEn: And so, this is the law which has been promulgated by the Lord about the daughters of Zelophehad: Let them marry whomever they may wish, but only among the men of their own tribe,
verses.textLa: Et hæc lex super filiabus Salphaad a Domino promulgata est: Nubant quibus volunt, tantum ut suæ tribus hominibus:

verses.textEn: lest the possession of the sons of Israel become commingled, from tribe to tribe. For all men shall take wives from their own tribe and kinship;
verses.textLa: ne commisceatur possessio filiorum Israel de tribu in tribum. Omnes enim viri ducent uxores de tribu et cognatione sua:

verses.textEn: and all women shall take husbands from their same tribe, so that the inheritance may remain within the families,
verses.textLa: et cunctæ feminæ de eadem tribu maritos accipient: ut hereditas permaneat in familiis,

verses.textEn: and so that the tribes may not be mingled together, but may remain such as they were separated by the Lord.”
verses.textLa: nec sibi misceantur tribus, sed ita maneant ut a Domino separatæ sunt.

verses.textEn: And the daughters of Zelophehad acted according to what was ordered.
verses.textLa: Feceruntque filiæ Salphaad ut fuerat imperatum:

verses.textEn: And Mahlah, and Tirzah, and Hoglah, and Milcah, and Noa were wed to the sons of their paternal uncle,
verses.textLa: et nupserunt Maala, et Thersa, et Hegla, et Melcha, et Noa filiis patrui sui

verses.textEn: from the family of Manasseh, who was a son of Joseph. And the possession which had been distributed to them remained in the tribe and family of their father.
verses.textLa: de familia Manasse, qui fuit filius Ioseph: et possessio, quæ illis fuerat attributa, mansit in tribu et familia patris earum.

verses.textEn: These are the commandments and judgments which the Lord ordered by the hand of Moses to the sons of Israel, in the plains of Moab, above the Jordan, opposite Jericho.
verses.textLa: Hæc sunt mandata atque iudicia, quæ mandavit Dominus per manum Moysi ad filios Israel, in campestribus Moab supra Iordanem contra Iericho.
